dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, ominous clouds of smoke.  A beat of semi-calm. And then... A long blast of TRACER FIRE cuts through. And another.  And another.  We TILT DOWN to discover we are --

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (1998)
dialogues.text: A city on fire.  A block here, block there.  More TRACER FIRE.  A cross between the LA riots and Gulf War.  A SUPERED TITLE:  LA RIOT III.  And then FADING IN BELOW: MONTH 4.  We CONTINUE MOVING ABOVE the ravaged city --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) You imagine what it was like when they had to fly choppers through this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gliding totally silently INTO FRAME is the biggest, darkest, midnight blue blimp you've ever seen.  Small gold letters on the side -- LAPD.  Fully armored beneath. Woven kevlar on the sides.  BULLETS REBOUND with a long ZZZZZIP off the sides.  PING SOFTLY off the plastic armor on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand where we're going and why the hell we're bothering anyhow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new voice responds.  This one brooks no discussion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there's anger and there's frustration, and then there's pure fucking evil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN SPARTAN peers down into the fiery landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we're going is pure fucking evil. (beat) Thirty people who were riding that muni bus are still missing.  I've got this bad hunch about who took them and where they are...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Way up ahead, amid the flames, is a fortress.  A square city block.  Walled.  Something out of the middle ages. The walls are entirely made from stacked abandoned cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan is dragging a heavy bag up towards the door. PILOT #2 looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come they call you Demolition Man?  Are you with the bomb squad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan gets his bag into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... (shrugs apologetically) ... demolish things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks out the window.  They're not quite there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do my job, shit happens. (to Pilot #1) Get a thermo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT takes a thermogram of the building in the middle of the compound.  We see a series of heat-outlined figures moving inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six.  One still, in the middle. The rest moving around.  I don't see any thirty people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking the thermo) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the naked eye, out the window, tucked against the wall of cars, a large tarp.  To the thermo, the still warm inner workings of the muni bus.  Faint outlines of the engine, drive train, even seats and frame.  Bingo. Spartan takes a deep breath.  Loosens up his right shoulder.  Loosens up his left.  Checks the gun on his right hip.  Checks the gun on his left.  They both cross draw.  Reaches down to the bag at his feet.  LAPD in reflective letters on the side of a backpack.  Spartan yanks some kind of rope out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that for getting people out of burning buildings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slaps a carabiner onto a big eyebolt by the door.  They'r dead center now over the complex below.  He opens the door.  Jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan falls three hundred feet from the blimp.  Dead silent.  The line runs free behind him.  It's a giant fireproof bungee cord.  As the downward force of gravity and the upward pull of the bungee become exactly the same, Spartan stops dead in the air for just the briefest moment.  Whips out a Bowie knife and slashes the cord above his head.  Falls free the last ten feet to the roof of the building.  Lands on his feet.  Lightning cross draw.  A gun appears in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lookout pops up on Spartan's right.  Spartan clobbers him.  Another lookout pops up on Spartan's left.  Spartan ducks, rolls quietly, clobbers him, too.  Listens.  No one's taken notice.  Holsters the guns.  Moves in towards the roof hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacked with armaments and stolen goods.  M70's straight outta the National Guard Armory.  Crates of ammo.  Stacks of looted Sony HoloSets still in the boxes. Spartan makes his way carefully along.  Ready.  Spins at a SOUND.  Nothing there.  Spartan crouches low.  Slips around the crates.  At the far end, a very large guard is doing just the same thing to peer at where Spartan just was. Spartan launches himself at the guard.  Hammers his head against the floor.  This guy is not getting up again for a long time.  Spartan spins at a SOUND.  Another equally large guard dives on Spartan from behind.  He never makes contact.  Spartan uses his momentum to fling him past and into the wall.  This guy isn't getting up again in the near future either.  Now the room is clear.  Moves towards the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON PHOENIX snorts a long pale blue line up one nostril.  A long pink line up the other.  One blue eye, one brown eye.  Blond hair.  Black skin.  Looks up at another thug.  Punches up the security cams on half a dozen slightly futuristic monitors.  Unconscious guards can be seen on all of them.  And on the last, Spartan, coming... Phoenix jabs a loaded orange syringe into an arm.  The drugs all hit various lobes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan creeps quietly down.  Looking, watching, listening.  Suddenly, the stairs are racked with MACHINE GUN FIRE.  Chips of concrete fly from around his feet. Spartan flattens against the wall.  Half a beat.  Steps out FIRING.  The machine gun stops.  A body plummets by down the center shaft of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a warm welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is dumping can after can of gas all over the floor, the walls, everything.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL AND LANDING
dialogues.text: Spartan steps onto the landing.  Checks high and low. Room is clear.  He can smell the gas.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Simon pries open the fuse box.  Flips off all the breakers.  Building is plunged into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SPARTAN
dialogues.text: Spartan quietly speaks into the LAPD button mike on his lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout some light, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a beat later, blinding white light blows through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blimp casts down a wall of light.  32 million candlepower pours straight down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wild melange of white, white light and dark, dark shadows.  The gas fumes ripple, refract in the air. Lights bounce off the pools of gasoline.  Spartan rolls into the room.  Both guns come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Phoenix.  You're under arrest. (then) Where are the muni passengers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Spartan.  They're gone. I told the city no one comes down here anymore.  Cops figured it out, postmen figured it out.  Damn bus drivers wouldn't listen. Arrest me?  You've got no jurisdiction here.  You're in my kingdom now.  Fifty blocks in every direction.  And it's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over?! (knows it's true) Yeah.  It's over.  But I've been king once, and I ain't ever going back to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan keeps the guns trained on Phoenix.  Simon scratches his arm.  It's a junkie's twitch.  Or is it... Spartan can't see it, but there's a kitchen match tucked behind Simon's ear.  Phoenix reaches up to scratch another itch.  Frees the match in one gestures, strikes it and tosses it into the pool of gas.  Smiles.  A friendly happy smile. The room bursts into flames.  He throws back his head and laughs.  Spartan dives on him.  Tries to hurl them both through the window. But Phoenix is either stronger or just far crazier and drugged up.  Smashes the two of them into the wall instead.  They trade blows.  The building gets worse. AMMO starts to EXPLODE downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant LAPD wrecker with a cow catcher front blasts through the main gates.  LAPD Humvees follow. A young cop (ZACHARY LAMB) gets out, looks at the main building, shakes his head in amusement at the destruction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Spartan again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle continues.  The two trading blow for blow in this fiery arena.  The two men are practically on fire. Finally Spartan knocks Phoenix cold, a clean shot straight in the face.  Phoenix drops in a heap to the floor.  Spartan shakes his head, sighs, bends down to retrieve his prisoner and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUILDING EXPLODES.  Long and LOUD and high and mighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fireball rockets by the blimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilots with mouths agape as the fireball crashes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EARTH RUMBLES.  Those who aren't thrown to the ground dive for cover.  The SECONDARY EXPLOSION kicks in.  Everything that didn't blow straight up in the air blows out what remains of the sides of the building. Nothing's left standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust begins to settle.  Flaming wreckage and embers are still dropping from five hundred feet up.  A beat.  A beam shifts in the wreckage.  It's a big beam.  It moves aside.  Spartan emerges dragging his prisoner out behind him.  As he's being dragged along, Phoenix comes to. Spartan hands him off to another officer to be booked. Captain STEVE HEALY, Spartan's long-suffering captain and friend, comes out of the crowd of officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? That's why nobody ever invites you over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate small talk.  You sent me to do a job, I did it.  It wasn't even me who blew everything up this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy continues to shake his head in consternation.  No way he believes that... Spartan ignores him.  Wipes the soot from his face.  Shakes his head in disgust, walks away... The Tactical Fire Response vehicles have arrived.  Fully- armored firemen wearing bulletproof gear fight the blaze. Spartan continues to stride away.  And then everything fucks up.  One of the TFR OFFICERS in the wreckage calls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.  Captain! (shocked) There's a lot of bodies in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan stops dead.  He looks sick.  Healy's not thrilled, but he knows what's required of him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spartan) You have the right to remain silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan in stark white overalls.  A beautiful, shaken woman holding the hand of a small child.  About six. Spartan bends down to the little girl.  Unclenches his fist.  His LAPD badge inside.  Pins it on the little girl, KATIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be back.  I'll still be your dad.  I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the badge, nods solemnly.  Spartan kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's young enough that it's unclear whether she understands that her father is going away for good. Spartan chokes back a sob.  Stands back up.  Kisses his wife.  Everything that can be said, has been said.  They kiss again. Behind him, in front of two locked doors, are a pair of prison guards in odd, heavily-insulated uniforms.  Tanks, heater batteries, guns.  Spartan heads towards the far doors.  They follow.  Spartan steps through the doors, the guards now at either elbow.  And into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CryoPenitentiary is a Godel-esque nightmare of architecturally-perverse layers and levels, the Guggenheim mixed with industrial meat locker.  All still half under construction. Spartan is led along the middle ring to where a doctor, two white-coated technicians and a young-looking WARDEN SMITHERS are waiting. Above him prisoners are encased into the ground in massive glass hockey pucks, contracted into pained fetal positions.  Their faces are hauntingly twisted into gargoyle expressions of tortured struggle. The group arrives at an empty chamber.  The technicians nod to Spartan.  He drops off the white overalls.  Steps free.  Stands naked.  Doctor injects him with luminescent blue fluid.  The techies slap on sensor pads.  Head, heart, all over... Spraying him down with Freon.  Mist everywhere... We see the temperature dropping on the monitors.  The Warden looks at a crib sheet.  Clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan.  You've done great deeds for the city of Los Angeles, so it is with some regret that I hereby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan shivers, contemplating one of his stiffening hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan.  You've been sentenced to 70 years in the California CryoPenitentiary for the involuntary manslaughter of thirty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan is beginning to shake from the cold.  His lips turning blue before our eyes.  Color just drains away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, John. (then; a smile) Don't catch cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuh... fuf... funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technicians attempt to help Spartan into the chamber. He shakes them off to stagger down on his own.  Let's not kid ourselves, he's scared --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya next century...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLES BEGIN as... The casing door is closed over him.  MONITORS down the lining of the circular chamber show a digital rap sheet, a dropping thermometer, a parole date, and today's date: November 20, 1998.  A super-chilled clear goo flows in, packing and preserving isolated Michelangeloesque segments of the defiant statue that is John Spartan. But he's still conscious.  Still even struggling a bit. On the arm above the chamber, inside a vacuum bell a small vial is auto unscrewed.  LOCKED and SAFETY lights cycle.  We see a tiny white chip inside.  The vial is moved into place by a tiny robot arm.  Bottom vent is opened.  The chip is dumped into the chamber.  It's the opposite of watching ice shatter.  Instead, the whole hockey puck goes solid in an instant and a half.  The thermo read-out drops in an instant to a half degree above 0 degrees Kelvin.  It's done. The VIEWER makes a GENTLY DIZZYING JOURNEY AROUND the chamber, SETTLING FOR A MOMENT ON Spartan's contorted- into-a-defiant-sneer face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIEWER'S VIEWPOINT KEEPS PULLING OUT to see that the date on Spartan's MONITOR now reads August 3, 2042. Warden Smithers, now a bespectacled, gray-haired old man, in a peculiar uniform, shuffles past the completely unaged Spartan. He grumbles by in a phone headset equipped with fiberopti video gear, and OUT OF FRAME we see that the prison has become vaster, stranger, with multiple grated catwalks and more networks of artfully-engineered piping. And heavily, heavily stocked with prisoners... Smithers looks up at his holoset.  Hovering in front of him in the air is Lenina Huxley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mellow greeting, Warden John J. Smithers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this again) Yeah.  BE well.  Lieutenant Lenina Huxley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 2042 police car glides INTO FRAME.  We MOVE WITH it as it passes by a series of austere geometric buildings. Green, green glass.  Blue, blue sky.  Cleaner than Disneyland.  The future is perfect.  More emissionless cars gliding silently by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it is a beautiful Monday morning, and as my duty log irrationally requires it...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel, the mischievously-beautiful LENINA HUXLEY.  A heads up display announces she is calling Warden John J. Smithers.  The order of business is "Prison Population Informative Query."  And future or not, Lenina fusses with her hair.  With both hands. The steering wheel is not present at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hereby querying you on the prison population update. (hopefully) Does the tedium continue?

dialogues.speaker: ON HEADS UP DISPLAY
dialogues.text: Warden Smithers gently reminds her that ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incontrovertibly and unequivocally, yes.  The prisoners are ice cubes. They do not move.  They have no thoughts, they have no feelings... The tedium is permanent, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smithers is striding along, the conversation projected in the air in front of him from the HoloSet he's wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find this lack of stimulus truly disappointing... Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smithers peers at her almost suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try not to.  However, you are young, think all you want.  Things don't happen anymore, we've taken care of all that.  I'll fiber-op you back after the morning non- parole hearings.  Have a peachy day, Lieutenant.  BE well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden's image poofs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugging off his headset, Warden Smithers clacks to a checkpoint wall at the end of the grating.  Smithers puts the back of his hand on a screen in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coding accepted.  Retina Confirm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smithers leans into a peephole.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE PEEPHOLE
dialogues.text: A harmless red laser flickers over an EXTREME CLOSEUP of the Warden's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall slides open and Smithers enters into a ceiling- less space beneath the awesome tiers of cryo-cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you and be well, Warden William Smithers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smithers grumbles past a barely conscious cryo-prisoner, who is strapped atop a sleek, thin, and uncomfortable "wheelchair."  Two Guards flank the hunched over and dripping convict as Smithers plops behind an industrial chic table and flicks on his CompuClipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-nine years ago, the parole system, as you know it, was rendered obsolete.  Federal Statute 537-29 requires we go through the formality of a hearing for all prisoners incarnated before the repeal of the parole laws. Cocteau Behavioral Engineering, B.E. will continue rehabilitation by altering your behavior through synaptic suggestion during cryogenic sleep.  Nightie night. Your hearing is now over.  You are to be returned to your cryo- cell immediately... 'Mr. Horace Bateman.'  Do you understand what I've said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes half open, the Cryo-prisoner unsuccessfully gropes for a syllable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards, nod his head for him... (yawning) Ne-xt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the pathetic Cryo-prisoner is wheeled off, the Warden's VOICE ECHOES electronically from ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a steel intercom box on the wall.  Two Med Techs load a still unconscious prisoner into another wheelchair.  We don't see him.  Just a hint of a well muscled black arm and a head still lolling unconscious on a shoulder, with blond hair...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Huxley finishes primping.  Hits a button.  The dash unfolds, a steering wheel emerges, locks into place. Lenina calls out as she activates her badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley, Lenina.  Coding on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A serenely annoying VOICE answers her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No police presence is requested in the city at this time.  Report to the station.  Good morning, Officer Huxley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans) Ahhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I detect a promoted level of stress in your tone.  Would you like me to prescribe a foodaceutical to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  What are you, my mother? (then; calmer) No.  No, thank you though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls her eyes.  Waits to see if it's going to scold her again.  After letting her sweat it out, the car doesn't ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll be reporting in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley's police car glides by.  A beat.  In front of one perfect building is a small object the size and shape of a COFFEE CAN.  As we PUSH IN TO it, we find, it's TICKING.  We can see the escape wheel ratcheting back and forth.  It's very crude, very 1920's clockwork.  Four ink-filled quadrants on a wheel inside.  The yellow quadrant rotates into position. A small sharp EXPLOSION.  Like an ink jet, the yellow ink is flung through a nozzle against the wall in an 8 x 20 foot swath.  The red ratchets and FIRES, the blue as well.  Now we can see the graffiti bomb has screened a message on the wall -- "Life Is Hell."  The black EXPLODES.  Little Death's Heads are sprinkled around the message.  The ink jet MACHINE BLOWS itself up. Pedestrians gather and stare at the message.  Mouths open, dumbstruck. Two shock poles emerge from hidden panels in the side of the building.  A sheet of LIGHTNING FLASHES between them.  The message turns to ash and falls to the ground. The poles tuck back into their boxes.  A small rabbit- sized VACUUM SWEEPER emerges, ZINGS along on its own power and SUCKS up the ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the chaos, we discover this whole thing's been a diversion.  Up from a manhole comes a strange-looking pipe.  A crude periscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching as a food delivery truck pulls up to a loading dock.  Food pallets are unloaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, that's it. (beat) Twelve hours there'll be another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS PAYNE, a young wild-haired madman in some kind of ancient mechanics coveralls watches through the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... These assholes are nothing if not predictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two other equally disreputable types are with him. SCRAPS, leftovers from the perfect world above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) We're not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guy, it doesn't really matter if we're ready or not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne's got things to do, people to see.  Takes off down the tunnel.  The other two follow.  As the periscope ducks back down ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of frosted doors reading S.A. and P.D. slide open to the presence of Lenina Huxley.  She enters into a police station not of typically bustling pandemonium, but shocking, softly lit tranquility.  Multi-ethnic officers of all shapes and sizes murmur about, monitoring screens with the casualness of the staff at a new age bookstore. No rush, no worries... Lenina strides past an impossible PERKY DISPATCHER chirping into a high tech headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings and salutations, welcome to the emergency line of the San Angeles Police Department.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOUGH looking COP, sipping a vibrant green juice, sidles up to Lenina.  They exchange a non-touching "handshake" that has them each making a circle with their open palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess, all is serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with true shock) There was a defacement of public buildings.  Walls smudged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked as well) Really?  Brutal.  Why wasn't an all cars notified?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cut off by her by-the-book superior, CHIEF GEORGE EARLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there was no need to create widespread panic. (then) Lieutenant Huxley, I monitored your disheartening and distressing comments to the warden this morning.  Do you actually long for chaos and disharmony?  Your fascination with the vulgar Twentieth Century seems to be affecting your better judgement. You realize you're setting a bad example for other officers and sworn personnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the attitude readjustment, Chief Earle.  Info assimilated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina turns and walks through her open office door, making a face out of sight and ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- curses almost silently under her breath as she enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanctimonious asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MORALITY BOX on the wall picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina Huxley, you are fined one half credit for a sotto voce violation of the verbal morality statute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lettering appears on the face of what appears to be a block of solid marble.  A thin sheaf of paper slides off the front with the reprimand. The contrast between everything we have seen so far and her office is staggering.  Her quarters are filled with framed and faded nostalgia pieces of the 20th Century. Posters of violent movies, books, magazine covers, ad signs, artworks and framed newspapers, all of a dark nature.  A hopelessly sweet officer, ALFREDO GARCIA, sits in the middle of the room shaking his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew... That was tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina gives him a deadpan glare:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was tense??  Tell me something, Garcia, don't you get bored codetracing perps who break curfew and tell dirty jokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I find my job deeply fulfilling. (looking around) I just cannot swallow the reality of this office, Lenina Huxley. You're still addicted to the 20th Century high from its harshness, buzzed by its brutality.  Holy smokes, is there anything in here which doesn't violate contraband ordinance 22?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sweet smile) Just you, Alfredo Garcia.  Don't you ever want something to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodness.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were going to say that. (sighs) What I wouldn't give for some action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Phoenix is still fighting to shake off his defrosted confusion.  Locks eyes with the warden. The look he gives Smithers is chilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Phoenix, one of our first and most illustrious members.  Let's get this one over quick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smithers is unsettled.  Phoenix is far more awake than the norm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-nine years ago, the parole system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoic; no logic yet) Twenty-nine years ago, the parole system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmer) ... was rendered obsolete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also firmer) ... was rendered obsolete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Do you have something to say in your behalf, Mr. Simon? (beat) I thought not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bemused) Yeah.  Yeah, I do. (it puzzles him, but...) Teddy bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a LOUD BUZZ, the electronic MANACLES around Phoenix's arms and feet fly open.  Phoenix knows a good thing when he sees it.  Immediately panthers up for a savage kick into Guard One, doubling him over.  Phoenix tears from Guard One's holster an air-injection syringe that is filled with the luminescent blue liquid.  He FIRES the SYRINGE right into a charging Guard Two's forehead.  Turns and approaches slowly and menacingly at Guard One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just able to breathe again) How did you know the password to the cuffs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing with pleasure; who cares) I have no idea... (then) Simon says, too much talking from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix smashes Guard One in the neck.  Left handed. Crushes his larynx.  The Guard falls dying to the ground. Smithers crawls over his table, breaks for the door. Phoenix effortlessly latches out to his fleeing neck and pulls him face-to-face as the Guards behind them shiver into rigidity.  Grins at him.  Plucks a sharp pen from the warden's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW FROM PEEPHOLE
dialogues.text: The harmless red laser again flickers across Warden Smither's now bulging eyeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conference area wall slides open, revealing Simon Phoenix, elegantly holding the warden's detached eyeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access granted, Warden William Smithers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix flicks the eye away and struts forward.  The wall shuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  And BE well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix glances at the speaker.  The future is fucking weird ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall on the side of the station house suddenly becomes translucent.  A map of San Angeles filling the wall.  A small red dot blinking in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serenely; meaninglessly) One eight seven.  One eight seven. One eight seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to drone on in the background as the scale of the map decreases over and over again zooming in on the Cryo-Prison.  The blinking red dot remains constant. The Perky Dispatcher punches 1 - 8 - 7 into a keyboard. Examines the screen.  Faints dead away.  Falls from her chair.  The Tough Cop rushes over.  Sees the screen.  He drops his juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, oh my, oh my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a basket case.  Garcia and Lenina come into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a one eight seven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina shrugs.  She has no idea.  Runs to a nearby terminal.  Punches it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Murder-Death-Kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punches another button.  The map is replaced with an image from the Cryo-Prison.  Two dead guards.  Warden Smithers crawling painfully toward the door.  It's a brutal image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I show two stopped codes at Cryo-Prison X23-1. William Smithers, Warden.  Severe injury.  Do you wish to assign a medic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warden stops crawling.  Collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Update:  specification deceased. Do you wish to assign a coroner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Earle arrives manfully on the scene.  No idea what's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with all of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cryo-Prison, sir... Three non- sanctioned life terminations... (ready to cry) Murder-Death-Kills.  Three MDKs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle sinks into a chair.  Cops all over the station are in severe, gasping trauma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half in a prisoner's smock and half-dressed in salvaged parts of the guard's uniform, Simon Phoenix strolls outsi the austere prison building, crossing an unimaginably perfect green lawn.  Before him, in a small parking area, a DOCTOR, wearing a white coat over "stylish" duds, opens up his sharp user-friendly sportscar with the code on the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your mouth and say 'Ahhhh!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon's having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina streaks past her zombie co-workers, cool under fire, to spin the main computer screen to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access the Cryo-pen's morning hearing schedule... And then give me... wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A list of names flashes on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Phoenix.  Simon Phoenix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grizzled African-American veteran, ZACHARY LAMB, steps behind Lenina, covering traumatic memories with a stoic shudder.  He points to Phoenix's name on the hearing list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew him.  We all knew him.  He's evil like you've only read about, girl.  He's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that thought, Zachary Lamb. (to computer) Simon Phoenix's code.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no specifications on file for Simon Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L7, you're not coming down with another virus, are you? What's Phoenix's code!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it, Lenina Huxley. Phoenix isn't coded.  He got chilled back in the 20th, before they started lojacking everybody ... I was a rookie then... He was a big dealer.  Narcotics. Software.  Wetware.  Anything. Declared his own kingdom in South Central L.A.  M.D.K.'d whatever got in his way.  In a bad time, he was the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcia has punched up a camera view of a prone body in the parking area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One stopped code in penitentiary parking area.  John Mostow, doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Perky Dispatcher has come to.  Begins to sob and then to wail.  Lenina can't concentrate.  Gives the Dispatcher's rolling chair a firm push, sends her drifting away across the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, L7... (dramatic pause) Is the doctor's conveyance still in the parking zone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor's vehicle has been code- fixed at the corner of Hollywood and Vine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glorious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering; back on his feet and taking command) Fine work.  All nearby units. ProtecServe Hollywood and Vine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The adrenaline in the control room surges.  Tears are being wiped away.  Justice is near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix twists out of the doc's car onto a completely unfamiliar Hollywood and Vine.  The rotating and SPEAKING STREET SIGN may say so, but nothing else is recognizable. Brutal-killer is briefly confused-child, as Phoenix tentatively soaks in his surroundings.  A TROUBLED-LOOKIN GUY in his twenties stands before a CompuKiosk.  Half phone booth, money machine, half computer terminal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno... Lately I just don't feel like there's anything special about me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an incredibly sensitive man, who inspires Joy-Joy feelings in all those around you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix savagely pushes the Troubled Guy away.  The kiosk is an open booth with a row of large buttons, a monitor, and a keyboard. Phoenix curiously examines the row of buttons:  Ego Boost, Citizen Confessional, Public Psychiatrist, Atlas, Serenity Sayings, Banking, Mail, Telephone Directory... he's gotta know.  Pushes the Ego Boost.  Half a beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just hearty as hell) You look great today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, feel great, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The future just amuses the hell out of Simon.  Phoenix slams down the information button.  He drops his hands onto the keyboard and his fingers fly.  His grin grows wider and wider.  His fingers stop and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have reached secure mailbox facilities for... Simon Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Information flashes by.  Thomas Payne's picture, rotating, life history scrolling by, maps, routes, over- head and underground plans of the city.  Phoenix takes it all in.  Light speed.  No problem.  His fingers fly again.  The screens finally end with an image of a pis- tol.  Rotating, exploded views, metalurgy information. Phoenix exhales a confused grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Wonder if I can play the accordion now too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noun:  Gun.  Portable firearm. This device was widely utilized in the urban wars of the late 20th Century.  Referred to as a gun, a pistol, a piece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a history lesson, Hal!  Where are the fucking guns?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A morality BOX attached to the kiosk BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are fined one credit for violation of the verbal morality statute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin sheaf of paper slides off the front with the reprimand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well fuck you twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOX BUZZES TWICE to his left.  Two more sheets of paper appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your repeated violation of the verbal morality statute has caused me to notify the San Angeles Police Department.  Please remain here for your reprimand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is ready to punch in the screen when two S.A.P.D. patrol cars pull to a dramatic halt behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, fuckers are fast, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon beats the Morality Box to it.  BUZZES at it first. Grins.  Four cops get out.  Unsheathing electronic stun batons.  They switch on.  Blue phosphor glow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina and the other cops stand in front of the wall monitor.  It shows an angle of the scene from a building corner mounted camera turret.  The image pans over and locks onto Phoenix as he stands at the information kiosk. The police can be seen moving in.  The cops in the squad room begin cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chalk one up for the benevolent ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another squad car pulls up behind.  Two more cops emerge. Phoenix looks casually at the six of them.  The police move forward, blue sparks now spitting from their electrified batons.  The SQUAD LEADER glances down to a hand-held Strategic Apprehension Computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniac is imminent.  Request advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a firm tone of voice, demand maniac lie down with hands behind back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Phoenix, lie down and put your hands behind your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix lets off a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez gosh.  Six of you.  In such tidy uniforms.  I'm so scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops look puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they have irony anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix turns back to the terminal.  His fingers fly. Under which --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) Maniac scoffs at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approach, and in an even firmer tone of voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix finishes a final keystroke.  The graffiti remov- ing shock poles burst from the building beside them. Fires.  Electrocutes and cooks one of the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nearest cops approach with their stun batons.  Simon kills them both.  It doesn't take long.  He breaks a neck, he spearhands a sternum, drives a jawbone into a skull.  It's all very graceful.  Death ballet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarcasm? (turns to two terrified cops) Will you be staying to die, or running away in fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and run away.  Simon leaps over the squad car. Now he's in front of them.  They freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh, I didn't say running away would help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catches up with the two of them.  Kills them both. Effortlessly.  Just for variety uses a different style of martial arts this time.  Two more are left.  They're frozen.  Deer in the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon says scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops watch in horror as the last two go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon spots the SecurityCam.  Comes towards it with a leer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the electronic distance, cops recoil in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon rips the cover plate from the camera stanchion. Yanks out the transmission cables.  Looks directly into the camera.  He's having a very good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the giant monitor Simon glares at them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody stand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the cops in confusion and fear do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon looks straight at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) ... and the home of the... (holds the note for all it's worth) ... brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jams the spark wand in the main transmission cables. Sign off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every MONITOR in the station blows to STATIC.  Huxley's fingers fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost every camera for six blocks around. (thinking fast) Going to Cahuenga at twelve hundred millimeters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the big screen -- Cahuenga Security Cam POV.  When the zoom starts, we can't even see Simon, when it ends, we can see him highly compressed by one of the squad cars. Under the hood.  Jamming the stun baton around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going for the vehicle battery core.  Its capacitance gel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon finds what he's looking for.  He backs off.  The CAR EXPLODES.  Smoke everywhere.  It clears.  No Simon. Dead silence in the station.  The car still burns silently on the giant screen.  Lenina punches it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall, silver needle rising from a plaza complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RAYMOND COCTEAU lectures at the end of a conference table.  We don't see who he's talking to.  He has that weird serenity of the obscenely-wealthy or a President- Elect-far-life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is not the defacement of public buildings. (turning to someone else) The problem is not the noise pollution of the exploding devices. (turning to yet another) The problem is that these hooligans who have left the comfort of our society feel a need to spew hostility at the bosom they have relinquished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We REVERSE to see, instead of chairs with people in them, the table is surrounded by HDTV video monitors on swiveling mounts.  Each screen has the face of a San Angeles department head and his/her sphere of responsi- bility:  PublicWorks, Orderly Conduct, Public Dietary Concerns, Litter... Twelve swiveling video heads, all watching and listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other video heads turn and nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And mar they may, these halfdozen miscreants infecting the public consciousness with their bile and venom.  And while I am saddened, truly saddened, they have left, we cannot allow them to impair the harmony of San Angeles.  They are but vandals and Visigoths. (then) Forty-four years ago when Los Angeles exploded in violenceAnger, violenceHatred and violenceFear, a disease had erupted... A disease not socio-economic, but behavioral. People had simply forgotten how to behave... We cannot allow it again.  That time, politics, law, even force were useless to affect change... We have triumphed over all of that. The same principles of B.E., Behavioral Engineering, I have applied to cryo-prison were expanded into the design and execution of what we now call... (gestures proudly) San Angeles, a city as fine as any one of the holding facilities I've designed.  We have a peacefulSafe, and above all, happyhappy population.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIDEOHEADS nod and MUTTER their approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even now I am positioning actions, postulating proceedings.  I expect your trustConfidence and certitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always Mayor/Gov Raymond Cocteau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau's assistant, ASSOCIATE BOB, comes in the room. Gives Cocteau a significant look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the VideoHeads) If you will excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves dismissively at the MONITORS.  The SOUND MUTES. The video freezes.  Bob is a large man with an oddly high-pitched voice and a strangely-officious manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor/Gov Raymond Cocteau, a cryocon has effected self-release from the penitentiary. (shaken) It is quite horrific.  Murder- Death-Kills.  All categories of chaos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enhance your calm... Enhance your calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau gestures to the frozen video heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be well them for me.  Get Captain Earle on the Holo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle nods and shudders in front of the shimmering image of Raymond Cocteau.  He's really shook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just... I mean it was so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle's image appears on all the VideoHeads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to do everything in your power to get this madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau clicks off the Holo.  Rolls his eyes.  As if the cops have a chance against Phoenix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle nods.  He has no idea what that might entail.  He looks really ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BE well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence reigns.  No one knows what to say.  Lenina has her head in her hands in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) He M.D.K.'ed everyone in a six man squad.  With a Strategic Apprehension Computer.  Destroyed an official government vehicle. 'Everything in our power,' what else is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody has a clue what to do.  Lenina looks up.  An idea forming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zachary Lamb.  How did they apprehend this fiendish Simon Phoenix back in the 20th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve-state manhunt... Satellite surveillance... A video-bite on 'Unsolved Mysteries'... None of it worked.  In the end, it took one man.  One cop.  John Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina looks at him with a pleased and spooky smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcia, Earle, and Lamb are huddled before Lenina's console.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Shot after shot of Spartan emerging from the wreckage of destroyed buildings dragging his prisoners behind him. Everytime:  Wreckage, Spartan, Prisoner.  Wreckage, Spartan, Prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is real life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barely.  Spartan's a legend.  I did an historical study on him last year, which I guess none of you swallowed.  One thousand arrests in three years.  All real criminals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a lot more business back then.

dialogues.speaker: MORE WRECKAGE
dialogues.text: This time Spartan is marching away from a flaming, over- turned police car, carrying a young girl.  A TV camera crew scrambles up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you reconcile the fact you destroyed a three million dollar mini-mall to rescue a girl whose ransom was only 10,000...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good answer.

dialogues.speaker: LENINA
dialogues.text: smiles at the screen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a recommendation?  Your 'Demolition man's' an animal, a muscle-bound grotesque who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is clearly the man for such a job as this.  You could reinstate him.  He hasn't worn a shield in over forty years.  Or much else, for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be seventy years old by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile slowly unfolds on her face.  Lamb knows where she's going as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON a Status panel:  Cellular activity:  Null.  Tempera- ture:  .5 degree K.  Lights begin to cycle.  A SERVO WHINES.  The CAMERA MOVES TO the chamber as the autolock begins to unwind.  Unlock.  The arm moves aside.  The frozen puck rises from its chamber.  Spartan hasn't moved, blinked in 40 years. Two Techs in insulated suits and gloves stand on either side.  Both wear tiny flip-up welding goggles.  The first, takes out a Durameter.  Tests the puck.  Harder than steel, a little less than a diamond. Tech #2, holds a handheld Magnesium Thermite Laser. About the size of a skill saw.  For the first time we notice there are six small raised half domes on top of the puck.  Indices.  Drops the guide ring at the end of the MTL over an index.  Flips down his goggles. Fires the MTL.  The entire puck lights up white white. We almost get the feeling Spartan can sense what's going on.  A burst of energy melts a small hole in side of puck.  We STAY ON Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tech #1 drives over a crane with a six-clawed arm. Like a standing forklift.  Or a gladiator... the fingers drop into the laser cut holes.  They raise the puck.  Carry it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The puck sits on a stainless steel podium.  Completely alone in a round stainless steel room. Three MTL lasers begin to pulsate madly.  One from above cutting in, spiraling in towards Spartan.  The others top and bottom shaving an eighth of an inch in a tenth of a second with each pass. The puck shrinks away, the beams grow closer and closer to Spartan.  Just before they would hit him, the beams turn blue.  Steam bursts from the puck.  Fills the air. Obscures everything.  The lasers stop.  Darkness. The entire chamber splits open.  A room within a room. Spartan rolls over limp and supple collapsing, onto his back.  Med Techs rush in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina, Garcia, and Earle are standing at one end of a long table.  Gaping.  Spartan sits slumped at the other end of the table.  Draped in a grey industrial jumpsuit. Still half comatose. Earle is shaking his head.  He can't believe he agreed to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is within the power of the police charter, sir.  He can be released on limited parole and reinstated to active duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not enough to collect the 90's.  You have to bring them back to life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau said everything in our power.  I still can't think of a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That still doesn't mean it's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all watch warily.  Spartan comes to with a start. Looks up at them.  Looks around quickly for any immediate threat.  Sees none.  Tries to stand.  Can't yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Garcia, the nearest; rasping) You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gulping Garcia creeps to Spartan.  Spartan claws out, ripping Garcia down to rasp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan pushes Garcia away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it's Thursday.  Tomorrow's Arbor day. (beat) And last week you turned eighty- four years old.  Happy Birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley comes over.  Clear and concisely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, I'm Lieutenant Huxley. The year is 2042.  Now the reason you've been released...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking it off) How long have I been under?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to focus) I had a wife... What happened to my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife's light was extinguished in the Big One of 2010. (off his confused look) Uh, she died.  In an earthquake. The earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes a moment to sink in.  Then, defrosting, haltingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife and I, we had a girl.  A daughter.  I made a promise. What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, I am Chief of Police George Earle.  We did not thaw you for a family reunion.  It is fortunate the lieutenant even did a probe on your wife.  This is about you and a Mr. Phoenix. A Mr. Simon Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fully awake) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning Phoenix escaped from this cryo facility.  We've had nine murder death kills so far. We have become a society of peace, loving and understanding.  And we are, quite frankly, not equipped to deal with this situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her like she's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There have been no deaths of unnatural causes in San Angeles in the last sixteen years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Santa Barbara, Los Angeles, San Diego metroplex merged in 2011.  You are in the center of what used to be Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up.  He's way stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Just great. (then) God, I'm so hungry.  I'd kill for a burrito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They back off in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just an expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan creaks his head toward Garcia, spooking him back away.  Spartan vigorously scratches his hand as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get me some Marlboros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Right away.  What are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigarette. (relinquishes his brand loyalty) Just get me any cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigarettes are not good for you and it has been deemed that everything that is not good for you is bad.  Hence... illegal. Alcohol, caffeine, contact sports, meat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you shittin' me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, you are fined one credit for a violation of verbal morality statute 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at it in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, you are fined one credit for a violation of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as I was saying) Bad language, chocolate, gasoline, uneducational toys, and anything spicy.  Abortion's also illegal, but then again so's pregnancy if you don't have a license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caveman, let us finish all the Rip Van Winkle and get moving. A Mr. Phoenix has risen from the ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.  I tracked that dirtbag for two years, and when I finally brought him down, they turned me into an ice cube for my trouble. Thanks, but no thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conditions of your parole are full reinstatement into the S.A.P.D. and immediate assignment to the apprehension of Simon Phoenix, or you can go back into cryo-stasis. (then; more softly) Not many people get a second chance, John Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan remembers.  The freezer was bad, way bad.  He swallows hard and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley and Garcia are waiting by the police car out front.  Half a beat, John Spartan, now completely done up in a 2042 cop uniform comes out.  He feels like a buffoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to be, a drum major?  This isn't a cop uniform. Am I gonna lead the Rose Bowl parade?  What is all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Direct biolink readouts for vitals, VOX radio connect, base and inter officer coded by rank, partner status and case priority.  And that's the pocket for your whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (God save me) Great, in case one of the floats gets loose I can direct traffic.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Spartan is stuffed into the back seat of Lenina's police car.  Absently scratching the back of his hand, Spartan stares out his window in amazement at the shiny, happy people in the happy shiny city.  Meanwhile, Lenina and Garcia are staring through a rearview screen at Spartan with equal amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This all probably seems quasi- strange to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quasi-strange?  This isn't my city.  How do you expect me to protect it?  I don't get you people, let alone like you much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come from a society in which the average l8-year-old has witnessed 200,000 acts of simulated violence.  In our society the number is closer to four.  If someone off the street was to watch the Three Stooge Men and see the Moe-person hammer the Curly-person, they would weep, John Spartan, weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at her.  What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myself, I'm a bit of an afficanado of the shocking, real and fiction. In fact, I perused many a News Disk of you.  That time you wow- fully tractor-pulled the Santa Monica pier into a heap of rubble in order to snare that team of hit men who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trails off, as she sees Spartan staring out the window shaking his head, very much alienated from every- thing around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem very much alone, John Spartan.  Not everything is that different.  Perhaps you would like to hear the oldies station. 'Oldies.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO quickly turns ON and changes stations to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sometimes you feel like a nut, sometimes you don't. Almond Joy's got nuts, Mounds don't. Because sometimes you feel like a nut, sometimes you don't.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most popular station in town. Nonstop wall-to-wall minitunes. You called them commercials.  Wow, this is my fave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fat kids, skinny kids, kids who climb on rocks. Tough kids, sissy kids.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina and Garcia join in for a sing-a-long finish as Spartan turns back to the window, eyes bulging.  He goes back to scratching his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Even kids with chicken pox love hot dogs, Armour hot dogs. The dogs... kids... love... to bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody put me back in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotions are still a little frayed at the station, but a certain peace has returned.  Lenina approaches the Tough- looking Cop.  They again exchange nontouching circular hand spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New inforama on Simon Phoenix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None... So where is John Spartan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to the bathroom... I guess he got all thawed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan trudges through a spooked gantlet of 2042 officers.  The Tough Cop greets him, raising his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I formally convey my presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan reaches out and shakes the Tough Cop's hand. It's like he spit on him.  The Tough Cop tries not to react, but he's clearly disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not used to physical contact greetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Hey, you guys are out of toilet paper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toilet paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suppressed giggle) They used handfuls of wadded paper, back in the 20th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire station roars with laughter.  Spartan stands unamused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy you're happy but in the place where you're supposed to have toilet paper, you have a little shelf with three seashells on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) He doesn't know how to use the three seashells!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station roars again.  Spartan shakes his head and scratches his hand.  Suddenly, the elderly Lamb comes INTO VIEW.  Spartan's mouth falls open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach Lamb, what happened to you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got old.  It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping, smiling) Motherfuck.  You were a snotnosed punkass rook!  Look at you. You're fucking old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nearest Morality Box dutifully BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, you are fined three credits for a violation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three sheets of paper come off.  Spartan looks at it. Grins.  Walks over to the machine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, fuck, piss, crap, damn, bitch, bitch, damn.  Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole sheaf of paper peels off.  Spartan gathers it up. It wads nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for the three seashells. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan examines all the TechnoWonders as Lenina punches up an illustration on the screen:  a small, square micro- chip being surgically inserted into the top of a hand. It's tied into the veins and blood supply as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Phoenix isn't coded.  An organically bioengineered microchip was developed that could by sewn into the skin.  Sensors all around the city can zero in on anyone at any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even conceive a visual of what you cops did before it was developed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We worked for a living.  This fascist crap makes me wanna puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're scratching, caveman? You really surmise we'd let you out without control?  Your code was implanted the second you thawed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan seethingly contemplates his itching hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just shove a leash up my ass?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty meat-eater!  No matter how Viking your era was, I cannot digest how you ever wore a badge! You're going back, John Spartan, oh yes, you're going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you two please dump some hormones?  We need every cortex we can get in this situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need him.  Our computer has already examined all feasible scenarios resulting from the appearance of Simon Phoenix and determined he will attempt to start up a new drug lab and form a crime syndicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is correct, Chief George Earle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to interrupt you two lovebirds, but that's fucking stupid.  You think he wants to build a business?  Phoenix is going for a gun.  Plain and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Spartan rages, roaming around the station, Morality boxes have heart attacks keeping up with his offenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is a complete meglomaniacal fucking psychopath.  And the first thing Simon is going to want to do is wipe the smug smiles off your shiny faces. He could just handshake your asses to death, but who's got the goddamn patience.  Trust me, he's going for a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares what this primate thinks. Resonate some understanding.  The only place a person can even view a gun in this city, is at a... museum!

dialogues.speaker: HALL
dialogues.text: The museum is located in the Cocteau complex.  Phoenix wanders through a hall arrayed with displays of various '80s/'90s/'00s/'10s artifacts.  A Girl Scout Troop (in modernly-modulated uniforms) looking down as we realize that large sections of the floor of the entire museum are transparent.  Below is an archeological exhibit of a section of the old city -- parts of buildings and streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you care to sample what it was like to spend a day in Los Angeles in the Twentieth Century please press the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Scouts presses a large red button.  HONKING CARS, SWEARING in Spanish, GUN SHOTS, SIRENS, RAP MUSIC... At the end of the hall, there's an arrow to another exhibit:  HALL OF VIOLENCE.  Phoenix grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home sweet home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he heads down the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan, Lenina, and Garcia stride towards Huxley's cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hunch.  Trust me on this. It's a cop thing. (as they get into the car) I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan gets into the driver's side.  Lenina gets in the passenger.  A beat.  They both emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Earle sits before the vidphone.  Sweating. Cocteau's scary serenity stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enhance your calm, Chief. Please, share your disquietude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor/Gov Cocteau, we find the branching possibility exists the escaped cryocon, Mr. Simon Phoenix, may be on his way to the Museum of Art and History in your complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What permutation lead you to this curious conclusion?  Do you expect him to be homesick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond quietly enjoys his own wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, sir.  Do you not still have the armory exhibit downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Cocteau's look of quiet surprise ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exhibit begins with the crudest weapons, cavemen with clubs, stone axes, arrowheads, and moves up the ladder of history toward modern day -- Western Colt revolvers, an old-time gangster Tommy gun... In the middle of the room is a Civil War cannon.  A stack of cannonballs sits next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the future.  Where are the fucking phaser guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps moving down the line.  Past the 1940s, the 1980s, 1990s... And finally a weapon he doesn't recognize at all.  Magnetic Accelerator Gun.  AcMag for short. Phoenix grins. Punches the glass in the exhibit.  Hard.  His fist bounces off.  It hurts.  He looks around for something to break it with.  Nothing.  Side kicks a larger expanse of glass in front of another display.  Almost breaks it. Not quite.  Growls.  A MUSEUM HELPER/GUARD comes into the room.  Moves towards the annoyed Phoenix smiling pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mellow greetings.  What seems to be your boggle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boggle... (he sighs) I'm at the top of the food chain, ya know?  And I would prefer to use tools, not bruise up my hands and feet.  But I can't find anything in this place.  A rock, a crowbar, any heavy object. Tell me, whatta you weigh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard looks at him in total confusion.  Phoenix grabs him by the lapels and shot-puts him across the room into the GLASS.  This time it SHATTERS impressively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very mellow ALARM GOES OFF MURMURING "PLEASE EXIT" over and over.  Simon begins sorting through weapons available.  Loads a SHOTGUN from the case.  Tests it by BLOWING up another display.  Works just fine.  The ALARM changes to "PLEASE EXIT RAPIDLY." It begins to annoy him.  He BLOWS the loudspeaker away.  BLOWS up the AcMag case.  Grabs the gun.  There doesn't seem to be any cartridges.  No way to load them either.  Aims, fires. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an information booth at end of the room. Phoenix can't help himself.  Presses the Ego Boost Button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great looking shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix chuckles appreciatively, presses the "?" button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Museum Patron.  Have you a query?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsa matter with the... (checks the name) Magnetic Accelerator gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graphics flicker madly on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magnetic Accelerator gun, the last produced handheld weapon of this millenium displaced the flow of neutrons through a non-linear cycloid supercooled electromagnetic force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what?  It needs new batteries?  What size?  Who sells batteries in the future?  Is there a battery store I can go to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GUARDS appear in the doorway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tough-ish) Excuse me, Museum Patron...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a second beat, Phoenix SHOTGUNS them both.  In the background we can hear the ALARM change "RUN.

dialogues.speaker: RUN..."
dialogues.text: A set of steel DOORS WHOOSH down, sealing Phoenix in. Phoenix turns back to the computer as ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AcMag, now reactivated, should concurrently supercool and achieve fission in...two point six minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at steel doors) Yeah, well, I was considering leaving quickly and patience is not one of my virtues. (beat) Who am I kidding? I don't have any virtues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughs at his own wit.  Grabs a shoulder bag from a Vietnam era GI display.  Starts loading up on weapons and ammo.  Kid in a toy store.  Examines, discards, chooses... And everything is free.  He turns to the Civil War cannon.  And grins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAPD car is parked at the curb.  Doors popped open. Museum patrons and guards flee.  Spartan, followed by Huxley and Garcia, moves against the flow. A cylindrical metal periscope suddenly pops up from the sidewalk.  As Spartan stares down at it, the periscope zips back down the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  I give up trying to figure this place out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Procedure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish communication with maniac intruder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. (he takes the S.A.C., smashes it to the ground) Hey.  Luke Skywalker.  Use the Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan heads for the door.  Garcia has a distraught moment before following.  Garcia hands Spartan a stun baton.  It SPARKS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a glow rod.  It's what we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan casually pokes out to a nearby scared guard. The guard drops like a dead weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got him trapped in section eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapped?  The Maniac Intruder? That I doubt.  Oh, would you make sure for me that nobody else is in the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understands) Done. (as she turns to the guards) I want a visual.  Now.  Every corridor in the museum.  I want full sensors routed to me.  And I want it ninety seconds ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to scurry.  There's a moment as he appreciates her skill and ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now empty.  Spartan strides along.  Sparking bullshit stun baton in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan approaches.  Can see the sealed steel doors. There's an emergency release beside them. Checks the stun baton.  Reaching for the handle when, the DOORS EXPLODE at him.  Blown aside.  Fire, smoke every- where, a battered cannonball bouncing down the hall. Spartan hurls himself through the hole in the doors. Takes cover behind one of the exhibits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix stands behind the Civil War cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amusing himself once again) What can I say, I'm a blast from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks like a mad bandito.  Draped in guns and ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Phoenix.  L.A.P.D., I mean San Angeles P.D.  You're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the voice come from?  Why does it sound so familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon unleashes a BARRAGE from a TOMMY GUN draped around his neck.  Keeps FIRING and FIRING and FIRING.  Empties it.  Not a very strategic move as he demolishes most of the cases in the room, including the one directly over Spartan. A Beretta falls at his feet.  An old police belt as well. Spartan yanks out the magazine.  Loads it.  Collapses the bullshit stun baton and tucks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands up or I'll shoot, Simon. (beat; to himself) Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan comes up FIRING.  Gets off about THREE SHOTS before Phoenix STRAFES the area with a HK91.  Dives for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying... (recognition jolt) Spartan!  John Spartan!  What's a guy like you doing in a century like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?  Simon says bleed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix unsheathes a pair of machine PISTOLS.  BLAZES away.  Tries the AcMag.  Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the AcMag) Come on, motherfucker. (then) Well, we'll do it the old- fashioned way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumps another load of black powder into the cannon. STRAFES Spartan.  Tamps the powder down.  STRAFES Spartan Spartan sees a 12-gauge auto loader and a box of shells across the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So lemme get this straight -- they defrosted you just to lassoo my piddly ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
