dialogues.text: The MAGAZINE EMPTIES.  Calculating the odds, Spartan dive and rolls across the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's concerned when there're no shots fired.  He oughta be.  Phoenix drops in a cannon ball.  Lights the fuse. Aims. Spartan comes up BLAZING.  Lotta firepower in a 12-GAUGE at close range.  Phoenix has a pair of SIX-SHOOTERS.  Bad Day at Black Rock.  CASES SHATTER.  The cannon's pointed straight at Spartan.  Displays collapse.  Phoenix flattens.  A mannequin falls across the cannon, pointing the muzzle down. Phoenix pulls out the now-fully-charged AcMag as the CANNON FIRES.  Right into the floor.  BLOWS out one of the transparent panels.  The two of them collapse into the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shooting, Spartan.  You killed the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke clears.  They're in downtown 20th Century L.A.  They've dropped into the archeological exhibit we saw before.  Spartan, shaking off the fall, finds himself weaponless.  Phoenix is spinning madly around, AcMag in one hand, an Ingram from his shoulder bag in the other. STRAFES everywhere with the INGRAM.  Tosses it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past is over, Spartan. (re the AcMag) Time for something new and improved. Like me... Now die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix aims the AcMag.  Completely silent.  Then the first OBJECT that intersects his aim simply EXPLODES. Whatever it is.  Phoenix laughs hysterically.  Likes this new toy a lot.  Fires again.  A working FIRE HYDRANT BLOWS UP off its bolts. Water is spraying everywhere.  Phoenix stands in it six inches deep.  Spartan yanks out his stun baton, steps clear, jams it in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to say Simon says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan activates the stun baton.  Phoenix is racked with pain.  Rattled and shaken by the charge.  Involuntary shudders.  Yanks himself clear with a wild grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a brave new world.  Sorry you have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FIRES.  Spartan dives for cover.  Just out of reach he spots the BERETTA.  Dives for it.  SHOOTS back.  It's like a popgun compared to the AcMag.  Anything but survival becomes completely out of the question.  Phoenix FIRES ROUND AFTER ROUND.  Everything he aims at just EXPLODES.  That Spartan lives through this at all is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau coolly walks through the freshly-landscaped courtyard. A large column of smoke rises out of a section of the museum.  Associate Bob frantically bobs about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure, sir, the Stress Breeder is inside being demobilized as we speak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BULLET WHISTLES by, barely missing Bob.  He hurls himself into the dirt.  Cocteau turns to face a jazzed- up Phoenix, still draped in weapons, the AcMag tucked in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, being frozen has thrown off my aim.  Don't worry, I'll kill you with the next shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix raises a Luger to Cocteau.  Something snaps. Phoenix's smile turns to a grimace.  His gun hand quivers.  He wants to kill, but he can't.  Cocteau folds his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no kiss-kiss.  No bang-bang... And you were doing so well.  Now, don't you have a job to do?  Don't you have someone you have to kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix looks at him.  Surprised and puzzled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan comes crashing out of the wreckage.  Loading the Beretta as he runs, a crazed scowl on his face. Phoenix leaps the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix bounds up a hill.  Jumps onto the back of a WHIRRING ELECTRIC TROLLEY heading by.  It picks up speed. He disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan takes aim - out of range.  Fuck.  Turns to Cocteau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know how fucking lucky you are that maniac didn't whack you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt whacking, whatever it is, would be extremely bad.  You scared him away and I do not know how to thank you.  You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan gives a SUSPICIOUS glance from the wall to Cocteau as Cocteau leads him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops and passersby are in a state of shock.  A column of smoke still rises from somewhere in the middle of the building.  2042 Fire Department vehicles arrive.  A fire- man jumps into a control stand atop the vehicle, pulls a joystick, and the entire back of the truck lifts off, unmanned drone.  He guides it towards the blaze.  Under all of which --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for an eighty-four-year- old!  Simon Phoenix knows he has some competition.  He's finally matched his meat.  You really licked his ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it's 'met his match.'  And 'kicked.'  Kicked' his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau takes a quivering Chief Earle aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly) Who is this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., Associate Bob arrives, tidily brushing dirt off himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective John Spartan. Temporarily reinstated to the San Angeles Police Department to pursue the madman Simon Phoenix. (ready to cry) You told us to do everything in our power to capture the madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I did.  Yes.  Yes, I did.  I do recall the exploits of John Spartan.  Didn't they call him... I think it was... The Demolition Man. (then) It's quite all right, Chief. Unexpected, creative, but quite all right.  BE Well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle nods.  Still terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, welcome.  So, what do you think of our fair society?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, I come to the future, Phoenix gets the ray gun, I get the rusty Beretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau addresses Spartan and the entire assemblage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, in honor of your arrival, and your protection of the sanctity of human life, namely my own, I wish for you to join me for dinner tonight. (sees Huxley at his side) The both of you.  I insist. You must accompany me to Taco Bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley looks seriously pleased and flattered.  Spartan just has no clue as to this choice of restaurants. Huxley discreetly elbows him.  Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh.  That'd be great. (befuddled) Looking forward to it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan is not happy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan is staring at a vid screen on a wall:  Cocteau, grinning, arms spread, his utopia behind him, and the Behavioral Engineering logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacely Sprockets here, who is now in charge, the 'Mayor/Gov,' who wants to take me to dinner at Taco Bell -- though Lord knows I wouldn't mind a burrito -- is also one of the guys who invented the cryoprison?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morality BOX BEEPS.  Spartan casually adds the paper to the collection in his breast pocket.  Under --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Cocteau is the most important man in San Angeles.  He practically created our whole way of life. Savage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he can have it. (choosing words) And rather than inserting barbed instruments up the rectums of those around you, perhaps you would care to sit on one yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flustered Earle gives a look to the morality box. Spartan turns to another vid screen.  A map of San Angeles on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix could be anywhere, but not having a code could hurt him. Limits his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.  Money is outmoded.  All transactions are through codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Phoenix can't buy food or a place to crash for the night. Pointless for him to mug anybody... (beat; thinks) Unless he rips off someone's hand. Let's hope he doesn't figure that one out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is momentarily nauseated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with all officers already patrolling in a citywide crisis net, it should be just a matter of tick-tocks before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know, we already have a back-up plan.  We can just wait for another code to go red.  When Phoenix performs another murderdeathkill, we'll know exactly where to pounce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Great plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Lenina gets the sarcasm.  She and Spartan exchange a look.  Spartan goes back to staring at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where the fuck is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan reaches without looking.  Pockets another warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is behind a shiny silver building.  Prying up a grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No front door, no welcome mat, what's with these people?  How you supposed to show up and kill somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves his own jokes.  Climbs down in.  Starts down a long ladder welded onto the side.  Shuts the grate behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 2042 skyline glistens.  Tiny cars zip along below us.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Spartan stares in amazement at Huxley as she prattles on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a touch embarrassed; a schoolgirl crush) I've been an enthusiast of your escapades for quite some time. I have, in fact, perused some actual newsreels of you at the Schwarzenegger library.  The time you drove your car through that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up.  The Schwarzenegger library...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the Schwarzenegger Presidential Library.  Wasn't he an actor when you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop... He was President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he was not born in this country, his popularity at the time caused the 61st Amendment which states...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving her off) I don't want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive in silence for a while, Spartan staring out the window at 2042 passing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep looking around, thinking about my daughter growing up in a place like this.  I'm afraid she's gonna think I'm some kind of disgusting primate from the past. As much as I want to see her, I almost don't wanna know.  I'm not gonna fit into the picture very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley reaches for the car terminal; thrilled with this small mischief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a minor misuse of police powers but I could do a search for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan reaches over, stops her hand.  Shakes his head "no."  There's a moment between the two of them.  He remembers he shouldn't touch her.  Lets go.  She doesn't seem to mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then; changing subjects) So, what's with this Cocteau guy? He thanks me for saving his life -- which I'm not sure I did -- invites me to dinner, and where does he take me... Taco Bell.  I mean, hey, I like Mexican but come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tone is quasi-facetious.  You do not realize Taco Bell was the only restaurant to survive the Franchise Wars.  All restaurants are now Taco Bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pull up in front --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is unlike any Taco Bell we will ever see.  Holographic images hover in the air in front of the marble entrance. A row of jacketed valets stands ready.  One rushes up. As they enter, a periscope pipe pops up, looks around, disappears.  No one notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparse, elegant and Melrose-dark.  As Huxley and Spartan enter a mariachi band takes their place in the corner. Huxley and Spartan walk up to a sultry future version of a Taco Bell order counter.  Spartan is trying to assimilate it all when the COUNTER-GIRL breaks the ultra- cool character of the restaurant to give him a typical fast food happy face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'll take a Burrito Supreme and a shake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will that be for here or to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  The eternal question... Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does a perky fast food spin to the station behind her and whips back a silver tray holding an ornate china set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burrito Supreme.  Shake.  BE well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks down to a miniscule cylinder of pressed kelp topped with a dab of salsa and small sesame-seed- type bits.  The tiny shake is in a thimble-sized frost- covered glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh.  Yum... Good thing I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mariachi band launches into the Mexican hat dance song as Spartan and Lenina, carrying their trays, are escorted by a maitre d' to a table set in a secluded section of the restaurant.  Cocteau and Associate Bob wait for them.  Cocteau stands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, the hero of the hour.  I congratulate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings and salutations, I am Associate Bob.  We met before, ever so briefly but I was groveling in fear in the humus at the time.  You have had quite the exciting first day in San Angeles. Imagine, chasing a real criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting) Imagine.  Could someone pass the salt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Salt is not good for you.  Hence it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan glares her quiet, pokes at his "Burrito Supreme." A beat.  Cocteau muses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, John Spartan, tell me, what do you think of San Angeles, 2042?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess, considering the way things were going when I went in -- I thought the future would be a sick, decaying pit of suffering and hate with a thick, foul stench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau gloats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should consider visiting New York/Jersey after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening) You mean nothing's changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Associate Bob roars in appreciative empty laughter. Think Ed McMahon.  Spartan looks at him.  It wasn't funny.  Pokes at his burrito.  Ugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you, John Spartan, pouting for the old cheeseburger -- the flesh of dying animals covered with cholesterol laden butterfat. You miss the bad old days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe. (then) Look, I like vegetables.  I even ate tofu a couple times.  But I got to choose when I wanted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we've gone too far?  You weren't here for the fourth and fifth riots. (harsh) Civilization tried to destroy itself.  People just wanted the madness over.  And when I saw the chance to make things right, I grabbed it.  San Angeles would not be here.  It would be your pit of stench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Maybe you can book me a flight to New York when this is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina's shocked.  Cocteau's not thrilled with his attitude either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your crimes, John Spartan, you would have surely rotted and died in jail by now.  Even you have to appreciate the persuasively tranquil humanity of the Cryo-Prison system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to piss on your parade, pal, but my 'cryo- sentence' wasn't a sweet lullaby. I had feelings -- I had thoughts -- a 44 year-old bad dream about thirty people in a burning building -- about my wife, beating her fists against an ice bucket.  It woulda been more humane to stake me down and leave me to the crows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were awake?  A person would go insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan stares out the window.  Across the street he sees a scragly SCRAP on a sputtery patched together motor bike in front of a large food store across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am saddened and stunned.  If there's anything I can do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan goes back to staring out the window.  Two, three, then four Scraps loitering, looking around, they've done nothing yet, but to Spartan's eye it's clear they're up to no good. The food truck approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) Just call for back-up.  I'll be across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, John Spartan, why... How, wha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out; as he leaves) One of those hunch things again. Bad guys about to do bad things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spartan is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The court of stores are located outside the restaurant. Spartan steps past the holographic images toward the food store. No one can mistake him for an exiting patron.  He radiates attitude.  Spartan picks up his pace.  The food truck is just pulling in.  The Motorcycle Scrap sees him. REVS the BIKE in a ferocious swerve towards Spartan. Spartan looks around.  Beside him is a street SIGN MURMURING "Third and Alemeda, Third and Alemeda, Third..."  Spartan rips it from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina, and the rest of the restaurant gather at the window to ooh in fear.  Cocteau scowls angrily at the Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scrap on the motorcycle has no time to dodge as Spartan stands his ground, jousts him clear out of his seat.  The motorcycle skids by, barely missing him, hits the curb, somersaults and explodes through the holograms.  Spartan doesn't even flinch. Still clutching the pole, Spartan makes a swift kempo- swing into the three other attackers.  And then, all hell breaks loose. EXPLOSIVE DEVICES EXPLODE the concrete inside nearby stores.  Scraps come pouring out.  Sewer COVERS are BLOWN asunder followed by chain- and nunchuck-wielding Scraps. An ALARM SCREAMS strangely and melodically.  The food truck is swarmed.  Inside the foodstore ten, twenty, thirty Scraps attack and loot.  Spartan sees there's a lot of them here.  A whole lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, they brought the whole team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more Scraps come charging out of the store. Clutching packages.  They hurl EXPLOSIVE DEVICES towards Spartan to make their escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina leads a round of giddy gasps.  Cocteau is not pleased with any of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan dodges the fusillade, looks around, takes stock of the whole situation.  An oncoming trolley comes around the corner into the complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if we can just get them to stay and play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan dashes to the trolley car.  He bounds up to the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BE well...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan tugs the driver along with him out of the moving trolley.  He javelins a mighty thrust with the street sign into the back wheels of the trolley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrons grow dead silent in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROLLEY teeters into a savagely awesome derail.  It goes into a SQUEALING, sparking SKID right into the food truck.  The slamming-to-a-stop trolley neatly angles into the truck trapping Scraps out front and inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrons unbridle themselves into actual cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan bursts forth from the trolley into the melee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scraps freeze for a moment.  This guy means business in a way they've never seen before.  But Spartan is dis- tracted for a moment by an excited yell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protein!  I've found protein!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't sound like hardened criminals to Spartan. More Scraps rush over to help him carry this booty away. A SCRAP appears beside Spartan, swinging a pair of nunchucks made from two knobby table legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) You're going to regret this for the rest of your life.  Both seconds of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunchuck Scrap thwaps Spartan.  Spartan just looks annoyed, not hurt.  Slams him again.  Still no reaction. Spartan latches onto a nunchuck in the air as it comes toward him.  Yanks it forward as he shoves the Scrap backward into the food store window.  The Scrap bounces off the window like a nerf ball, not remotely cracking it.  Spartan frowns to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm losing my touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two other Scraps attack him.  Spartan fends off one, shotputs the other into the WINDOW, this time SHATTERING it competely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the truck, Payne, under an enormous load of food, appears.  Takes quick stock of the situation.  He sees Spartan.  Has no idea who this guy is, but he's trouble. They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau smolders at the sight of Payne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HURLED SCRAP stumbles out of the window wreckage, falling to his knees.  As Spartan considers what the hell is really going on, and should he deck this guy, a bunch of cans of quirky food cascade out of the Scrap's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuine pleading) Please... don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan stops.  Backs away.  Watches oddly as the Scrap escapes.  He lets them go.  Steps back away as the others escape.  They don't know why he changed his mind, but they're not staying around to find out. Huxley and the restaurant patrons rush up to give him a blast of adulation.  Spartan's attention stays on the fleeing Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a reckless abandonment! Looks like there's a new shepherd in town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sheriff'... Who were those guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call them Scraps.  Voluntary outcasts, they cower beneath us in sewers, abandoned tunnels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're nothing but thugs and hooligans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau nods appreciatively; Bob is echoing some previous statement of his.  In the b.g., a team of uniformed engineers are patching up a hole in the ground using a set of steel planks, laser welders, giant cement spurting pastry bags...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spartan) You are even better live than on laserdisc.  Oh, and the joyjoy way you paused to make a glib witticism before doing battle with that strangely-weaponed Scrap it was so, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) Hey, this isn't the Wild West. The Wild West wasn't even the Wild West.  Hurting people is not a good time.  Well, sometimes it is... but not when it's just a bunch of guys who want something to eat.  You know, I think I liked it better when we were all supposed to fry in a nuclear holocaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau doesn't look pleased about any of this.  Spartan storms off.  Lenina, letting out a shocked breath, gulps and follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley's cruiser glides INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley, coding off.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Spartan watches as the steering wheel retracts into the dash.  Shakes his head.  Everything is weird in the future.  Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I'm sorry I yelled before... back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to make a dehurtful retraction.  I've assimilated too much contraband.  I fleshed you as some blow-up-the-bad-guys- with-a-happy-grin-he-man type, but I realize now you're the moody- troubled-past-gunslinger-who-only- draws-when-he-must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley.  Stop.  I'm not any of that... I'm nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touched, Lenina hands Spartan a small, unusual box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, here's what you asked for... Why do you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  It's just a... hunch.

dialogues.speaker: LENINA'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Lenina's CAR WHIRRS up to two giant, geometric buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too.  I have procured you a domicile down the corridor from my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is voice-coded.  So if you need something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just ask.  Lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights come up.  The place is like one of the 50's diners that never existed in the Fifties, the apartment is a monstrosity -- a melange of 80's and 90's styles never quite seen together in this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) What do you think?  I clicked off a lot of credits to create the perfect 20th Century apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure what.  Just nods at all.  She beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it? (then; a little halting) John Spartan, there is of course a well-known and documented connection between sex and violence.  Not so much a causal effect, but a state of general neurological arousal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at her.  He has no idea what her point is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after observing your behavior and my resultant condition, I was wondering if you would like to have sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had no idea that was going to be her point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you? (as she nods) Now? (as she nods again) Ahhh, ahhh, mmm, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns quickly to a cabinet and removes two strange high-tech helmets and a towel.  Lenina, all excited, puts one of the helmets on his head and hands him the towel. Flicks a switch on the side of the helmet -- read-out lights come on; activated.  Lenina sits upon a bed opposite Spartan, and repeats the operation on herself with the other helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you have to relax.  We'll start in a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having sex, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she flicks on the switch on her own helmet.

dialogues.speaker: VIRTUAL REALITY WORLD
dialogues.text: Lenina appears floating, a diaphanous gown blowing gently about her.  She floats slowly TOWARDS us, as she begins to peel off and discard pieces of the gown which dissolve immediately away.  As she approaches nakedness..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of open-mouthed amazement and enjoyment and then Spartan tears the helmet from his head and throws down his towel with a mixture of confusion and anxiety. Lenina is still seated across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?  You broke contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact?  I haven't even touched you yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina removes her helmet with some confusion and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... but I thought you wanted to make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is like boning Ms. Pacman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina stands, tossing her helmet down, and faces Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered) Vir-sex has been proven to produce higher orders of alpha waves during digitized transference of sexual energies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waddya say we just do this the old-fashioned way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, backing away in shock and disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uuuugh.  You mean... fluid transfer?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boning, doing the wild mambo, you know... (demonstrates) ... the hunka chunka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is no longer done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at her like she's out of her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exchange of bodily fluids?  Do you know what that leads to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, smoking, a desire to raid the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rampant exchange of bodily fluids was one of the major reasons for the downfall of society. (trying to explain calmly) After AIDS there was NRS.  After NRS there was UBT.  One of the first things Dr. Cocteau was able to do was outlaw and behaviorally engineer all fluid transfer out of societally-acceptable behavior.  Not even mouth transfer is condoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no kissing anymore...? I was a good kisser...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ughh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Procreation?  We go to the lab. Fluids are purified, screened and transferred by authorized medical personnel only.  Ugh. Ugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a savage creature.  John Spartan, I wish you to leave my domicile now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the door.  Stamps her foot.  Some things never change.  He wants to explain.  She stamps her foot again.  He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In darkness, Spartan loudly bangs into something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh.  Lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights come up.  The place is, well, spartan.  Exact same shape and size as Huxley's, but stunningly sterile and unwarm.  Spartan tragically takes in the place, pokes his head into a clinical bathroom, a bathroom with no toilet paper and a strange shelf with three seashells. Shakes his head. Spartan's hands start to quiver toward a knitting needle and a ball of red yarn.  Curiously furrowing his brow, Spartan plops into a strenuously uncomfortable futuristic chair and begins almost unconsciously knitting the red yarn.  He stops himself in perplexed surprise... Suddenly, a LOUD BOPPING noise fills the air.  A beautifu NUDE WOMAN, casually brushing her teeth, appears on a vidscreen before Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Martin!  I was thinki -- ohmyGod! I'm sorry, wrong number --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a panic, the Nude Woman reaches O.S. and the IMAGE CLICKS off.  Spartan smiles, then stops smiling.  He awkwardly calls out to the telescreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, telephone directory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (words appearing simultaneously on the screen) Videophone directory accessed. Spartan almost bails, but finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little worried) Do you have a number for a Katie, I guess it's Katherine now, Spartan?  Or maybe under her mom's name, Warren, or... (the thought hits him) ... her mom might have even re-remarried.  But she's passed away now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuts up.  Realizes he's been rambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as soon as he shuts up) Katie Spartan.  No ref.  Katherine Spartan.  No ref.  Katherine Warren. (pause, pause) No current ref.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listed offspring under Madeline Warren through 2010.  Listed different number domicile until 2028.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't believe he's having a dialogue with TV screen, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ref.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreading the answer) Did she die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No death certificate issued. No ref.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing she didn't die without permission.  Did she move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No relocation license granted. No ref.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting irked) Reason for 'no ref'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) What number do you wish to call? Hangs up on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image blinks out, replaced by clouds and the "BE WELL" slogan.  An annoyed Spartan stares at the screen. He picks up the strange box Lenina gave him.  Inside it is a stack of petite laserdiscs.  Spartan sticks the first laserdisc in his television. A surveillance camera shot shows the image of the explo- sion at the museum.  Spartan pops the disc and puts another in.  This time the surveillance village shows Cocteau and Associate Bob walking through the courtyard. Then the gunshot.  Then finally Spartan comes to the strange face-to-face between Cocteau and Phoenix. Spartan back-and-forth watches the stand~off with growing fascination.  He almost unconsciously reaches out to the sewing needles and the red yarn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Cocteau steps in.  Trailed by Associate Bob. Nothing happens.  He looks around wondering why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little annoyed) Lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I changed that.  Illuminate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights go on.  Simon is behind Cocteau's desk, his fe up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illuminate. (they go off) Isn't that nicer?  Go 'head, you try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Illuminate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond, bud, we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew.  Access codes, routes to secret underground kingdoms, the words to songs I thought I forgot... I've been meaning to ask you about this.  I can do almost anything.  I like this.  A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to lose his calm demeanor) Your skills were given to you for a reason.  Not for your personal amusement.  Your job is to kill this nuisance, Thomas Payne no one else in San Angeles can perform this simple task anymore -- and not to allow him to wreak any more surface harassing havoc.  And your ineptitude allowed it to grow worse tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) 'Ineptitude.'  Now I'd say that's a bit of a provocative word, Raymond.  Have you ever been down to the Wasteland?  Has anyone you know been down there??  No? (good; then I lie madly) Oooh.  It's bad down there.  Really bad.  It's a wonder I got out of there alive.  It's gonna be a big problem. (sorry, but...) I'm gonna need five or six more guys.  Easy. (then) You gotta list?  'Cause I don't wanna defrost no serial killers or mad dog types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're gonna be the only mad dog type?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a minute we might think Phoenix is insulted.  Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactemundo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau turns to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Take care of it. (then to Phoenix) Just get it over with... You're beginning to be more trouble than you're worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, don't say that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix chuckles.  Then, a little irked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is Spartan doing here, Raymond?  Who invited him to our party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau's gotta lie about this one.  Wasn't part of his plan either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish your business and I'll stuff him back in the freezer. Think of him as a guarantee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took care of Spartan before, don't worry your pointy little head about it.  Now to avoid this ineptitude, we need these guys thawed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau nods.  Yeah, whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illuminate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights go out again.  Simon chuckles madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting aggravated) Illuminate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing as he disappears) Nah, I changed it again.  See ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a distasteful fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau just looks at him.  Enough already...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut up, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina is waiting outside her car as Spartan emerges from the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all business) Detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in the driver's side) I've got to learn to do this sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan tosses Lenina a suavely-knitted sweater of familiar red yarn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you, Huxley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina holds up her new sweater with a tickled blush. Spartan determinedly presses buttons to get the CAR HUMMING off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a lovely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what they put in my Cryoslush, but I thaw out and the first thing I want to do is... knit.  How come I know what a zipper foot is, a shuttle, hook and bobbin, petitpoint.  I could weave a throw rug right now with my eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) It was your rehab training.  For each inmate the computer draws up a skill or trade which best suits their genetic disposition.  It implants the knowledge and desire to carry out whatever training was assigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a 'seamstress?'  Seamstress. Great.  How come I come out of cryoprison and I'm Betsy fucking Ross and Phoenix comes out and he can access computers, operate all vehicles, find the locations of every damn thing in the city? (he has a thought) Can you get me Phoenix's rehab program?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley punches madly away.  An ACCESS DENIED sign flashes on the screen, cutting her off.  Lenina gets into a little more furious COMPUTER playing until she gets a violent BEEP. A SWEET FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE CHIRPS along with corresponding printed information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix, Simon.  Rehabilitation skills; Urban combatkill, torture methodology, computer override authorization, violent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who develops the rehab programs? Attila the Hun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disquieted) Cocteau Industries of course. But why would Cocteau want to provoke madness?  He's always been obsessed with one thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... control.  The success of his favorite restaurants.  The end of kissing... I've gotta talk to this asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, John Spartan, you must be mistaken.  You can't accuse the savior of the city of being connected to a multi-murder- deathkiller like Simon Phoenix. It's... rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be subtle.  I'm good at subtle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina looks anything but reassured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am ever so sorry, John Spartan, but Dr. Raymond Cocteau is not here for your unannounced visit. I don't think I can access him at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan grabs him by the throat.  Pulls him inches away from his own face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choked) I'll give it my utmost efforts, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan shoves him back.  Bob drops to a keyboard.  His fingers fly madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wonder of wonders, I have him on FiberOp in the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau appears on a dozen swiveling VideoHeads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (condescending) Mellow apologies for my lack of physical disposition, Detective, but I do have an entire city/gov to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan wastes no time with pleasantries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run this.  You programmed Phoenix's rehab to turn him into a terrorist.  Now that you wussed out this entire society in a tribute to yourself you needed Phoenix to handle the cast-offs who wouldn't listen to your bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley cringes.  The MORALITY BOX BEEPS.  Cocteau stares at him with that weird hypnotic serenity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix's rehab.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the screens scroll into Phoenix's rehab file.  This time completely innocuous:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix, Simon.  Rehabilitation skills; Decorative Gardening, Retail Floral Arrangements...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you speaking of, Detective? My only interest in Simon Phoenix was in that of the creation of an expert Florist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florist?  Phoenix wouldn't know a prickly pear from a pair of pricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan yanks out the Beretta.  Associate Bob backs away while glancing furtively at a closed door.  BLAM. BLAM.  BLAM.  Shoots out three of the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even on video, Cocteau flinches visibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the museum, why didn't he blow your brains out?  I saw the security disc.  Phoenix had a full ten seconds to think about where to put the hole in your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little shook) John Spartan, this display of barbaric behavior was not acceptable even in your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  But it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM.  BLAM.  BLAM.  Shoots out three more.  Associate Bob faints dead away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a man like Phoenix has a gun to your head, ten seconds is nine and a half seconds longer than you live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the vid screen) Not everyone is as eager as you to resort to violence to solve all the difficulties in life. Even now I am beginning to wonder if the fracas in the museum was the result of Mr. Phoenix's presence or your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beretta appears next to Cocteau's head onscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau is in a corner of the room in front of a private Vidhead.  Spartan stands with Beretta pointed directly at him.  Nonetheless, Cocteau remains his arrogant self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder about this, shithead.  You think you can control this guy? Trust me... you can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; unfazed) Is there something specific you plan to do with that archaic device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan's not going to shoot him; lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, John Spartan, do you not query yourself that this misplaced hostility is the result of your transference of self hatred and personal loathing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you blame me for my role in the progenation of the cryo process.  That does not relieve you of your burden of responsibility for the commitment of your initial crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at him a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley visibly recoils.  The morality box BRAAAPS.  It never gets any further.  Spartan shoots it without a look, dead center.  His eyes never leave Cocteau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene of the Scraps' food truck attack.  As, ON THE CUT, Spartan wrenches off one of the steel planks.  It splits open with RUSH of AIR.  Earle had no idea how to stop Spartan, but he tries --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please cease this madness, enhance your calm, John Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it with enhancing my calm.  I'm going to find Phoenix and enhance his calm instead. I'm the only one here who can handle this situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you accomplish this, John Spartan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to blow his fucking head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan wrenches away another plank.  The others back off in fear.  It's like he's opening up the mouth to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, even if Simon Phoenix was programmed to escape, extinguish life and steal contraband weapons -- by forces known or unknown -- pray tell why are you proceeding to the depths of Wasteland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan wrenches off another plank.  Now the hole is big enough to enter.  A set of rungs can be discerned. Stops, looks at Earle.  How can they all not get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason the citywide manhunt didn't work was because Phoenix was down in the one place you A, can't monitor, B, are afraid to visit, and C don't give a shit about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then; braver) Whether Phoenix is down there or not, you just can't drop in. Resonate some understanding, the Wasteland is filled with thugs and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooligans, I know.  We might never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  You might like it down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at him with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a joke.  There's hope after all. (then) Hey, how bad could it be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody has a clue.  It could be really bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you two don't have to do this.  I can handle Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley checks her stun baton and lights up a lightwand, (a hand-held flashlight device) and follows him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Eastwood tough) Hey, come on, let's go blow this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's 'blow this guy away.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan, Lenina, and Garcia all carry lightwands and stun batons, treading forward through a wide sewer tunnel. WIND WHISTLES by.  A beat, then Garcia nervously sings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'My dog's better than your dog. My dog's better than yours... My dog's better cause he...' (to Spartan) Sorry, when I'm nervous, I... Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio creeps into an ornate piece of piping.  Lenina gasps at what she sees before her... They spill out into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in the Wasteland which is surprisingly busy and crowded.  People living in tents, lean-tos, whatever their ingenuity can provide.  Think Third World refugee camp underground, a souk.  Marketplaces, food stalls... The underbelly of the city lit from above by strand after strand of bulbs in construction cages and other fortui- tously salvaged lights, revealing odd tunnels of indeterminate former usage, abandoned subway platforms, natural caverns, a cutway of fifty years of sanitary landfill, the striations of decades of now useful trash being harvested.  Giant belt driven ventilation fans whirl in enormous airshafts overhead. The three move along taking in the curious but unfrightened glances.  More than one person recognizes Spartan from the battle the night before.  You can feel the buzz work down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thugs and hooligans, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea... we've always been told the only people down here were savages, who wanted only to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan, Lenina, and Garcia find themselves starting to sniff the air.  Spartan grins, while the others look ready to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that emanation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, oh yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio drifts toward a large, square hole in the sewer wall in front of which a smiling OLD WOMAN is smoking up some meat and tortillas on a makeshift grill.  Other Scraps sit in the space square behind, smoking cigarettes and eating on ratty armchairs between shabby travel posters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God, a real burrito... Smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salivating, Spartan silences Lenina by taking off her watch and giving it to the woman.  He snatches up a burrito and a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garcia) Buenos dias, senor....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan methodically switches back and forth from eating and smoking like a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best damn burritos I ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't ask where the meat comes from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see any cows down here, Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan's got one bite left.  Turns to the old woman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que esta esso carne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esta carne de rodentia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat burritos.  I'm eating a rat burrito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan thinks about it.  Eats the last bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was good.  Damn fine salsa too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias, Senor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley is nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and walk on.  Ignoring the very disreptuable looking cantina tucked into a carved out section of landfill.  As they go by, we PUSH IN with a seedy- looking patron to find --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as low life a place there is down here.  It's further dragged down by the presence, in the furthest back, darkest corner, of Simon Phoenix and Six Cryocons, freshly defrosted and each the size of a major appliance, ALBERT, BEPPO, CHARLIE, DANZIG, ELVIN and FRANCIS.  All a little groggy.  Phoenix, very execu-criminal, sits at the head of the raggedy bar table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, let's review.  It's 2042.  That's two oh four two, as in the Twenty-First Century.  The world is a pussy-whipped Disney Channel version of itself and all we gotta do to run the whole place is kill this guy, named Raymond, who put it all together.  Then as an added bonus, you get to kill the man who put most of us in the freezer, your pal and mine, John Spartan. (this goes over big; now for the plan) We can rape, loot, pillage, all the fun things you remember. This place is gonna be like a theme park, but with our kinda themes.  Let's get busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fixated on this previous point) We get to kill John Spartan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows his clientele) Over and over and over, if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beppo does like.  Nods.  Sounds like a good plan to everyone else as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing back his drink) Salud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan, Huxley and Garcia step in.  A meeting place of sorts.  A machine shop.  Off to one side, a giant belt driven machine shop out of 1900, taking its power from a water wheel, attached to an enormous transmission spinning furiously.  Mechanics fix and combine various vehicles into working fashion.  Blow torches, bellows. Another flume feeds a wildly churning wheel running the fans. We can see stalls and houses around the rim.  Out of date cars are being used as homes.  Spartan takes it all in. His eye catches a bright red 1969 Pontiac GTO beside the machine shop.  He's drawn to it in admiration, Huxley and Garcia in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice... A 1969 Pontiac LeMans GTO convertible with rear spoiler and hot wheel mags... Seriously beyond the standard package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very large caliber revolver appears alongside Spartan's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are these.  Why don't you put down the glow rods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan does.  The man with the gun is Payne.  Six other SCRAP TOUGHS have the drop on Lenina and Garcia with giant crude shotguns.  One of them wears a familiar periscope around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friends too. (they do) You got ball balls, cop, coming down here after the show you put on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tough as she can) We're looking for a MurderDeath Killer... Can you help?  Or just bully us with these primitive weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan shakes his head in disbelief.  Payne shifts his aim.  FIRES.  Blows a hole in the side of an abandoned car the size of a grapefruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe they're not so primitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not funny, not smart.  What do you want, cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne COCKS his PISTOL, aims at Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if it's a bad time we could come back later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always a bad time down here for questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got no business down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are all you people?  And why are you down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?  What the hell do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not from here.  Well, I am from here, but I'm not from Now.  And for all I can see, this whole place is as fucked up as where I'm from... I'd just kinda like to know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan still waits.  A crowd begins to grow.  Payne, despite the fact that he's the guy with the gun, decides to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us didn't tow the line. Some of us didn't make the grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan stares past Payne to wild pieces of graffiti on a wall behind him that includes "I HATE SAN ANGELES and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some of us just got tired of being told what to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you people weren't part of the Cocteau plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, this is the Cocteau plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time you go shopping, I'm not going to be in your way... (then) Listen, when the laws are wrong, men have to take it upon themselves to change them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne stares at him.  Spartan's sincere.  Payne lets his gun drop.  The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) John Spartan, you must uphold the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good-looking woman of about fifty looks up from the edge of the crowd with sudden interest at the mention of Spartan's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the old story, give up a little freedom for a little safety and soon you have no freedom and no safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pretty wise man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm just fifty years out of date.  But I do have another question. (off Payne's tacit approval) We're looking for a guy.  Black skin, white hair, one blue eye, bad attitude.  He's from my time, and if I don't find him, we're all in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne hasn't.  Looks to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods to Payne) Scoped him yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) You were right...

dialogues.speaker: VIEW FROM DISTANCE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the viewer is pulled out for a long view of Spartan talking to Payne.  Then one, two, three, four, five, six bodies step INTO the F.G.  Simon and his goons walking down the street.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: can't believe his good luck.  He chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I musta done something right in a previous life. (thinks; this seems really unlikely) Don't know what that coulda been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and quietly starts dispensing instructions to the cryocons.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The woman who looked up with such interest, steps over closer.  She's got to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan?  The Demolition Man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (surprised; looks at this older woman) Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's shaken, a tear rolls down her cheek.  She brushes it away.  Doesn't know how to react... Neither does he as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.  I'm your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wraps his arms around her, she him as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie, my little Katie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Kate, I'm older than you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll always be my little girl, I don't care how old you are. (steps back) God, Katie.  You're all grown up. I missed your whole life.  I missed everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and I always talked about you.  I always hoped I would see you one day.  I knew I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her at arm's length admiring her.  Then ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me everything.  I want to know everything about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing; it's fifty years) Everything?  All at once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan's grin, though it seems impossible, gets wider. He kisses her on the forehead.  Holds her back out at arm's length, just looking at her with this great big smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Absolutely everything. Start where I left off.  You were six...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan... (as Spartan ignores him; still busy) Spar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcia can only point:  Simon Phoenix, forty feet away, giant grin, AcMag in hand, taking aim. Spartan hurls Katherine to the ground, with himself as a shield as ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley, Garcia, and the Scraps who have a clue dive as the ACMAG FIRES with the resulting tremendous EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan, buddy, I brought some old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cryocons OPEN UP with all manner of WEAPONRY on the crowd.  Mayhem and slaughter.  Huxley and Garcia have taken cover as well.  Their stun batons look exceedingly useless.  Spartan is momentarily trapped under a collapsed beam.  Doesn't last long.  Growls.  Hurls it aside.  Comes up FIRING with the BERETTA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix FIRES again.  The AcMag round barely misses them. Spartan's blasted brutally by the EXPLOSION.  Stays on hi feet.  Keeps FIRING.  Albert goes down.  He's not going to get back up again.  Payne rises to his feet FIRING a giant REVOLVER.  The other armed Scraps follow his lead. Another AcMag ROUND GOES OFF.  The lights dim.  Spartan sprints for where he last saw Phoenix. Spartan can hear Phoenix CLATTERING off up a culvert behind him.  He bolts up after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It forks upwards.  Sixty degree incline.  Flattens out. Splits again.  Spartan halts, listens.  Follows the FOOTSTEPS.  Same trick works backwards, as Phoenix stops dead, hears Spartan COMING.  FIRES the ACMAG.  Misses as Spartan is just about to round a bend into range. The CULVERT itself EXPLODES, blowing shrapnel everywhere. Fifteen feet of it are gone.  It's an ugly, ugly jump. Two hundred feet down and no room to miss.  Off to one side, one of the fans spins madly.  Spartan leaps.  Hits the other side, grasping at shards of metal.  Pulls himself in.  It heads back up. Spartan ascends.  Up.  Up.  Now almost, and then completely vertical.  He climbs spread-eagled after Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pipe "T"s at the top.  Spartan mantles up as Phoenix CLATTERS off.  Down below in the pipe, the sound of SOMEONE ELSE FOLLOWING as well.  A gasketed porthole glints beside Spartan, he slams it open.  Looking down, he is a hundred yards above the cavern floor.  Beside him the chain arcing up from the machine shop below ratchets around a joint and heads off into the darkness in the direction Phoenix has fled. Half a beat.  Spartan reaches out, way out, and just manages to snag the chain.  Hauls madly.  CHAIN CLATTERS and CLATTERS.  Half a beat.  A long, low RUMBLE. Phoenix stops a moment, wondering what the hell it is.  A giant blast of water tidals through the pipe.  The AcMag is swept away. Spartan looks up to see Phoenix and a wall of water headed his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon smashes into him.  The two are swept along.  The force blows them off the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go with the flow, Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan and Phoenix are carried along by the water into an aqueduct.  Phoenix heaves himself over the side. Spartan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every Scrap can see.  The two hang on a suspension grid of an old rusty rebar, directly over one of the WHIRRING VENTILATOR FANS.  It's not meant to take any weight. Slippery as hell from the spray above.  The REBAR CREAKS and MOANS. No one dares move.  Below, Charlie lies dead.  No other cryocons can be seen. Spartan and Phoenix scrabble madly, yet in slow motion as not to break the old joints as they stay on.  Hand over hand, Phoenix makes his way along as ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, since we're just hanging out, I have to tell you something -- remember those muni passengers you blew to pieces trying to catch me...?  They were already dead, pal, before you even touched the building.  Cold as Haagen Dazs. (Simon grins his scary grin) See ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon swings himself back and forth, gaining momentum. The rebar's about to give as he launches himself out into space, just clearing the fan.  A wild twisting fall ending in a CLANGOROUS landing through three levels of Scrap lean-tos. Spartan feels the rebar starting to fail around him.  As he tries to haul himself up, it just gives way more.  The whole fan structure is giving way.  BITS of METAL fall, hit the fan and are sent CLANGING off into space. And then... it gets worse.  A NOISE from above.  Beppo appears.  Hangs from a firm support.  He begins to stomp on Spartan's fingers.  Laughing wildly. Spartan moves, he stomps them again.  Spartan moves again, but this time seeing a heavier piece of rebar nearby.  Snags it.  And as Beppo's foot comes down again, grabs it.  Hauls.  Beppo starts to scream.  His grip comes loose on the wet bar above.  Screams past Spartan as he falls.  There's a tremendous CUISINART SOUND. Blood flies up past Spartan as he climbs up to safety. He moves down the grid past the fan.  Sees below as Phoenix scrambles to his feet, starts to run.  Spartan doesn't want to do it.  No choice.  Growls.  Leaps. Falls.  Falls.  Falls.  Smashes into a garbage heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon pounds a rushing up Garcia unconscious in a single blow.  Recovers and empties a TOMMY GUN at the crowd. Scraps crawl for cover.  Payne and two others FIRE back. Phoenix disappears.  Spartan blitzkriegs out of the refuse.  Crazed. Spartan stampedes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knocked to the ground before her burrito stand, the Old Woman points inside the square room. Spartan comes in low, gun out, ready to fire.  No one there.  Spartan pivots into the square space, looking all around.  Then up.  An open trapdoor.  Spartan peers in.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR SHAFT
dialogues.text: A humongous steelwalled vertical shaft which rises up into the blackness.  The Old Woman's cubbyhole is really a huge freight elevator.  Phoenix is climbing up a cable with speedy precision.

dialogues.speaker: BURRITO JOINT
dialogues.text: Spartan drops down with a gleam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an elevator shaft on top of this place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then does that mean this place is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks around, tearing old travel posters off the wall.  Reveals a panel.  Large up/down handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off; with a sudden grin) Momentito, Senorita Huxley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoppers wander about admiring the cars.  Half a beat. The ELEVATOR can be heard SCREECHING upward.  And then a CRUNCHING stop.  The floor begins to buckle.  Customers flee in terror.  The VROOM of an ENGINE can be heard. The FLOOR CRACKS asunder.  The freight elevator emerges. A 2042 model is tossed aside as the elevator rises from the floor. The Wasteland Pontiac GTO convertible is jamparked in burrito joint crunching the place's chairs in a heap. Driver Spartan REVS the ENGINE as passenger Lenina shudders about what is to happen next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaya con dios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan drops the GTO into gear.  ROARS the CAR straight out the front window of the dealership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A maintenance hatch in the ground rises open.  Phoenix scrambles out.  Exhausted, greasy, dripping with sweat. At the far end of the courtyard, he sees --- Lamb keeping watch on the entrance.  A giant puff of smoke has come billowing out.  Lamb looks seriously concerned.  And at the same time kinda pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Demo Man is back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamb bends over to look.  As he does, we see a figure approaching from behind.  Simon Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.  Rookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix digs out a .22.  SHOOTS him repeatedly in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix... you're still... one ugly sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have said that, now I'm going to have to kill you... Ah damn, I forgot, I already did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamb drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: PONTIAC GTO
dialogues.text: Tears along, divoting up the pristine 2042 green, the car flinging a solar tower in its path to the ground, generally leaving trouble in its wake.  Spartan sees, in the extreme distance, Phoenix dashing from Lamb's crumpled body and the stolen police car pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan GUNS the GTO, SCREAMS it across, SKIDS to a halt. Leaps out.  It's too late.  Lamb is dead.  There's a half a beat with his dead friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I empathize with your loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks up and growls.  Strides to the GTO.  Huxley jumps in beside.  He floors it.  Huxley's head flies back against her seat.  The GTO THUNDERS out onto a shiny new San Angeles boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GTO CRUSHES a computer kiosk as it ROARS onto the street, aggressively PLOWING through the gentle user- friendly cars on the road in its terrifying pursuit of Phoenix and Lamb's stolen police car. Spartan FIRES out the window at the wildly fishtailing Phoenix, but the angle's just wrong.  Can't see and drive and aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls the gun back in.  One hand on the wheel, Spartan straight-arms the Beretta and aims through his own wind- shield.  It's like a video game.  Phoenix's fishtailing brings him into the sights.  Spartan FIRES.  His own windshield SHATTERS.  Blows into glass pebbles all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet rips against Phoenix's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix FIRES a wild salvo back emptying three or four different handguns.  SHATTERING the grill, BLOWING out what remains of the glass in the GTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan FIRES two rounds at each of Phoenix's rear tires, cleanly puncturing each.  The car swerves and fishtails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix struggles to control the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auto-inflate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the two TIRES reinflate with a WHOOSH and the car is back on a straight course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan grunts in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  Take over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan yanks her into the driver's seat and rises, standing out through the missing windshield.  Huxley barely holds onto the steering wheel and the car wildly swerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, I just push this pedal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She FLOORS the GAS and the GTO BURNS RUBBER, PEELING down the street.  Spartan is thrown back against the roof of the car, manages to hang on.  He opens FIRE on Phoenix's car.  Perforating it, blowing off side mirrors, generally making a mess of it as Phoenix weaves wildly back and forth trying to shake them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix looks in the rearview and clicks into a means- business mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer:  velocity control override!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State the nature of the emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arson. (as car picks up a little speed) Armed robbery! (as more speed; not enough) No, it's murder!  An entire family is being robbed in a burning building and they're all getting killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car SCREECHES its TIRES in acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan watches the car jet ahead at an amazing clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's accessed velocity override!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  Punch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenina really GUNS the GTO and races up on Phoenix's rear.  Spartan teeters out of the car to get a clear shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lenina rams the car.  Spartan flies off the GTO and lands on the back of Phoenix's car.  The BERETTA flies from his grasp.  CLATTERS away on the road behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix turns around to see Spartan hanging on.  He shoves a MACHINE PISTOL out his open side window and FIRES back at Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan ducks back from Phoenix's stream of bullets. Smashes the machine gun against the car, knocking it from Phoenix's grasp.  Just manages to trap it against the side of the car as it falls.  Snatches it up, lifts it up to take aim as ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix shouts at the car ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open doors!  Emergency!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both gull wing doors slam open.  The gun is bashed from Spartan's hand.  Spartan himself is smashed from one door to the other on the roof of the car.  A hundred miles per hour and nothing to grab onto.  He starts to slide off. Completely aerodynamic. Grabs onto a door.  Shoves a shoulder underneath as ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The right hand door slams shut.  The left hand door crushes against Spartan.  The MECHANISM GROANS.  Spartan growls back.  Spartan and the door strain against each other.  The man wins.  Wrenches the door clean off. Jumps in the car.  Punches Phoenix square in the head. Phoenix is knocked to his side.  Sidekicks Spartan dead in the groin.  Spartan folds. Phoenix leaps back up, triple-punches Spartan in the chest.  Spartan's hands come free, he falls back, as Phoenix jumps on him and slams his head repeatedly against the hundred mile an hour ground rushing by as the car drives itself. Spartan continues to fight back, smashing Phoenix, but he's forced to avoid the close calls with cars, street signs and the like.  Finally, Phoenix grabs Spartan's throat and holds him down in the road where an upcoming futuristic fire hydrant is about to tear his head off. Spartan sees it coming, has no choice.  Lets go.  Phoenix thinks he's rid of him. No.  Spartan slides free for a moment on the road and barely manages to hook a hand on the open door frame. Shirt three-quarters torn off, blood streaming, he climbs onto the back of the car.  Brutally punches his hand through what remains of the back window. Phoenix screams in rage as Spartan's hand comes at him and grabs him by the hair, yanking Phoenix's head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer!  Disengage Auxilliary Battery Pod now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan freaks as the back of the car suddenly separates from the rest of the car.  It shoots rearward while the cab with Phoenix drops a third wheel in back and shoots off.  Spartan, hanging on for dear life, turns to see him and the pod are jetting backwards for the front of a truly massive freight truck.  Four full trailers behind a massive cab.  The thing's gotta be eighty feet long. It's more of a locomotive than a truck. The burly TRUCKER also freaks when he sees he will impact with Spartan.  At the last moment Spartan leaps off the pod. Phoenix sees the truck collide with the pod, BLASTING it to smithereens.  He laughs as he enters a long tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
