dialogues.text: The Truck Driver is stunned and scared as he enters the tunnel but gets another scare as Spartan suddenly pops up at his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear!  Don't hurt me, please don't hurt me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan pushes the burly Trucker over and climbs into the driver's seat.  The Trucker takes one look at this mad man and decides his fate is safer elsewhere.  Leaps from the truck.  Lands safely in some shrubbery.  Sobs. Spartan GUNS the massive TRUCK. Phoenix thinks everything is A-okay until he looks in his rearview and sees a bunch of streetlights being taken out by the too huge truck and getting closer.  The truck harshly rams Phoenix, nearly jarring him from his seat but for the restraints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck and Phoenix's car ROAR out of the tunnel and move straight for the police station.  The truck smashes him again.  Phoenix's steering wheel locks up and his seat restraint pops up as he races out of control for the station.  He screams in rage. Spartan slams on the truck brakes, smokes, slips, slides, into the most horrific jackknife ever seen.  All four trailers lock up and accordian in on him. Phoenix's vehicle slaps the street curb and begins to roll, convulsing into a spectacularly flaming series of somersaults that violently climax at the base of the SAPD sign in front of the station. Half a beat. A charring Phoenix bursts from the vehicle, sees the approaching, out of control truck and turns and runs like hell. The truck slides in a full, unstoppable quadruple jack- knife towards the police station. Spartan tries one last ditch attempt to bailout, but his door won't open, forced in by the first trailer bent over from the force of those behind. The truck hits the curb, flips, collapses and plows into the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOOOOFFF.  SecuroFoam EXPLODES from nozzles everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What few cops there are flee in all directions... The truck followed by four trailers wipes out the station. Flames, ARCING POWER CABLES, EXPLOSIONS.  Demolition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire drones fight the blaze.  The cab of the truck, a door torn off, lies askew.  It's entirely filled with dense, solid foam.  Half a beat... It CRACKS open, Spartan appears tearing giant hunks of foam away.  Eyes wild. Earle stands, mouth agape, staring at the destruction. Spartan's reappearance doesn't make him feel any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You... Menace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huxley comes running up from the GTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Spartan, I thought your life force had been prematurely terminated.  Look at you, you're in shambles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still tearing off foam) Thought I was fucked this time too. (re:  his torn uniform) Don't worry.  I can fix this later. All I need's a needle and thread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks around, turns to Earle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need something, anything, a shotgun, a flare gun... (looks up) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle and Huxley follow his glance.  Coming across the green, a horde of Scraps, armed to the teeth, carrying the dead cryocons on two litters, and emerging from their midst beside Payne, Alfredo Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mustering command) Stun batons on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan gives him a look, are you out of your mind? Huxley ignores him completely as well.  Moves to Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get a bump on the noggin and you're Pancho Villa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. (to Payne) Loan me a gun.  Loan me two guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne thinks about it for a half second.  Hands his gun over, nods to someone else as well to follow suit. Spartan straps on two guns and a giant ammo belt .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scraps unearth half-a-dozen large explosive devices. Spartan loads them into the GTO.  Earle is ready to cry when he sees all this.  A catastrophe averted, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have used these weapons of mass destruction against the men and women who upheld the law?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would have used these weapons to shop for groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a beat.  Earle gets it.  There's kids in this crowd. And a lot of hungry people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Chief, I've had it with being a criminal.  I'm not a criminal. Think of me more as the head of the people's militia.  We're gonna go dump the tea in the harbor, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, cause tea contains caffeine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking again, right? (as Earle nods) Grin or something afterwards, people don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earle nods seriously.  Spartan steps over to the dead guys on the litters, pulls back a sheet.  He stares at the first guy.  Can't believe what he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these swarthy strangers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned; checks the second) I know these guys.  I arrested them years ago... Albert Collins, 22 known murders.  Beppo Zemoto, I don't even want to talk about what he did.  And they're out.  There were more too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud of him) I once checked, prior to your arrest, 45 out of 200 members of the multilife sentence wing of the cryoprison were your arrests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, that's not a very reassuring statistic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan turns, faces his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  You gave me this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out a tarnished barely recognizable gold LAPD shield on a chain.  Drapes it over his neck.  She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get killed.  Maybe we'll get to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell you I loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her gently.  Forty-two years of pain washing clean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hits her hard.  This is her dad.  Spartan gets in the GTO.  Huxley gets in beside him.  Looks at her.  Thinks about it.  She'll do as a partner... FIRES the GTO UP. The thing's a bomb on wheels now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hit anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattya mean?  I'm an excellent driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes SQUEALING OUT, clipping and KNOCKING OVER the one remaining WALL of the police station --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau, Bob, Simon and the remaining cryocons are there listening to Cocteau warble on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't counting on this, but I must say you've worked out beautifully.  People are terrified of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (don't flatter me) Ah, people have always been terrified of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau continues his eerie soliloquy, feeding Phoenix's amusement.  Phoenix walks behind him under this, takes ou a knife and behind Raymond's back, tries desperately to kill him.  He can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this time they're truly scared. Soon they'll want to take the next step -- security cameras in every room, stricter alarm systems against misbehavior, anonymous hotlines to their neighbor's infractions... (gloating) I'll have carte blanche now to create the perfect society. Everyone will want it.  An enzyme injection for all citizens that will insure everyone has the same I.Q., the same weight, and the same desire to think only happy thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is back where Cocteau can see him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty happy now.  I think I'll pass on that shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix steps off to one side, pulls an old Airweight out of his belt.  Aims it at Cocteau, tries, tries to pull the trigger.  Isn't going to happen.  He grunts in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost in his own reverie) Other cities will follow.  San Angeles will be a beacon of order with the purity of an ant colony and the beauty of a flawless pearl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  You can't take away people's right to be assholes. (then; it's been bothering him) That's it, that's who you remind me of -- an evil Mr. Rogers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocteau smiles.  Simon tosses the gun to Elvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try to kill him.  This is beginning to piss me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvin empties all six shots into Cocteau's very surprised face. Associate Bob looks on from the corner.  A little frightened, but not giving a shit about Cocteau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what shall I do with you, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am an excellent associate, sir. I could work for you. (off Phoenix's doubt of this) Dr. Cocteau actually had me endocrinecologically altered to never wish to be anything but an associate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the slang that would best express it across our chronological gap, sir, would be that he -- cut my balls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Literally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob nods; Simon claps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, it's a sign of weakness to cut the balls off the people who work for you.  I'm gonna get you a new set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do that now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a couple extra myself.  Not that I need 'em.  But just for spares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could interrupt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix looks at him; this is not a good way to start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the police are here.

dialogues.speaker: OUT WINDOW
dialogues.text: some ten stories down.  Sure enough Spartan and Huxley are exiting the GTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need to defrost more guys, Bob.  Lots more guys.  Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indubitably.  But the computer codes will have to emanate from this office.  We will need a few moments here before fleeing. (sits at keyboard; types away madly) I might suggest that the, uh, large gentlemen might be considered, ah... (sotto) ...disposable.  Especially with rather large supply forthcoming. Perhaps they could be sent to welcome Mr. Spartan.  If they succeed, so much the better, if not, they will at least hinder his progress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, Bob.  You have no heart. (then) Guys, John Spartan's on his way. Go downstairs.  Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over and over and over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, really, violent evil multi- lifers.  I want guys who understand that crimes come in bunches.  Not just a sporadic bit of violence or law breaking here and there.  I want guys who've been on killing sprees before. Men who've crossed state lines with impunity!  Do you understand me, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still typing madly) Perfectly, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna like running this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator slides open.  Danzig, Elvin and Francis spray it with GUNFIRE.  It's empty.  Spartan and Huxley slip in through a side door around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old criminals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.  She's a little cocky.  Spartan steps out into the hall.  Sees a giant shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvin steps out.  Spartan SHOOTS him through the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danzig and Francis look a touch more concerned.  They split up. Spartan moves cautiously down the hall.  Huxley a pace or two behind.  High above in an overly futuristic frieze looking much the modern gargoyle, is Danzig.  Grins. Dives on Spartan. Spartan is slammed to the ground.  We can feel the breath knocked out of him.  Tussles with Danzig as --- Huxley pulls out her stun baton.  Pokes at them, pulls back, pokes again -- unable with the twisting, turning struggling bodies to be sure she won't get Spartan. And misses the fact that Francis is coming up from behind.  He slaps the baton out of her hand.  Grabs her around the neck, lifts her in the air.  Begins to strangle her to death.  She kicks and claws at him without effect. Spartan's still busy with Danzig.  She starts to choke. Francis brings her closer to watch her die.  A beat of this, and Huxley reaches down and yanks the GUN out of his belt and SHOOTS him repeatedly. Half a beat later, Spartan finishes with Danzig.  The CRRRUNNNCH of his BACK breaking. Huxley's in a state of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man has died at my hands.  I have taken all his future from him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him or you, Huxley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhat mollified) There is that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan bursts in, gun drawn.  No one's there.  Spins, checks everywhere.  Spots a very dead Raymond Cocteau. Huxley sees him a moment later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrors.  Oh horrors.  Sic Transit Raymond Cocteau.  Oh, John Spartan, civilization as we know it will come to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does that every once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer screen catches Spartan's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks it out) Ooh.  This is bad.  Very bad. (as Spartan looks over her shoulder) He's accessed the cryoprison. He's about to defrost the entire multilifer wing. (beat) Most of them don't like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of them didn't even like their mothers.  These are bad people. (then) How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; dry) We have to stop that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the run, stepping over dead cryocons.  Huxley keys her BadgeRadio ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units, all units. ProtectServe Cryoprison.  Simon Phoenix assumed to be en route. (lifts the send button) Should I announce the demise of Doctor Raymond Cocteau?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  I think we're gonna cause enough panic on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prison is ringed by a high circular fence.  Giant stainle steel gates in front of the prison, a la the Federal Reserve, are shut tight.  A dozen futuristic squad cars strobe the area in red and blue.  The GTO RUMBLES up. Spartan gets out.  Huxley follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's inside already.  And it's completely sealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan takes only the briefest reconnaissance look around.  Shakes his head sadly ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crime against nature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leans into the GTO.  Pushes in the cigarette lighter. Puts it into neutral.  Wedges the accelerator down.  The GTO BELLOWS.  The cigarette lighter pops out and Spartan uses it to light the fuses on the explosive devices. Drops the car into gear.  Pulls his head out just in time as it ROARS off. The GTO SMASHES into the front GATES.  Wedges itself in from the impact.  Half a beat later, a long, low, THUNDEROUS EXPLOSION.  Smoke everywhere.  Smoke clears... It ain't much, but a man can get through now.  Spartan loads the spent cartridges in the guns from his ammo belt.  Huxley double-checks her stun baton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous as hell) Okay, look, I wasn't at all pleased to cause the fatality of that deranged cryocon, but I understand now that sometimes under particular circumstances that violence is necessary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes the stun baton from her and nails her with it mid- sternum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll understand this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls into Garcia's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on to her.  See she doesn't get herself into trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan turns, starts towards the Cryo prison.  As he walks --- Takes a deep breath.  Loosens up his right shoulder.  Loosens up his left.  Checks the gun on his right hip.  Checks the gun on his left.  They're both set to cross draw.  Steps through the breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frenzy of activity.  Simon, Associate Bob, Techs everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Cocteau would want every bit of haste from you! (sotto to Simon) If he was still extant that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy pucks are stacked and loaded to be defrosted. Med Techs scramble furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four pucks are being rapidly removed from around the cryocons inside by the cutting lasers.  They go blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inner room splits open and the Med Techs rush in to the four thawed cryocons as Associate Bob steps away from a VidScreen with some concern ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been a breach in the outer gate.  An intruder has entered the CryoFacility and I feel it's safe to assume it's John Spartan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is momentarily taken aback by Spartan's relent- lessness.  Then he looks at his four new recruits. They're still kinda dopey.  Turns to a Med Tech ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some really wild uppers? Speed, crank, amphetamines? Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little confused, but...) We have pure megadrenalin, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Whack these guys with it. A bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.  They come wildly awake, GUNTHER, HOWIE, IGNATIOUS, and JED.  Eyes wide, jittery, completely cranked.  Phoenix keeps it simple ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey wake up.  Good.  Listen to me.  You've just been defrosted. It's the future.  John Spartan is out those doors. (a beat; he smokes; this should be fun) Go kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther lets out the kind of scream the NFL would be proud of.  Charges out the door, others behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reception desk.  A Chaplain's office.  A BE Well bas relief.  Very quiet, very still. Spartan moves cautiously through.  A tiny rotating sensor picks up his presence.  Locks on.  As Spartan is looking the other way.  Dr. Raymond Cocteau, in holo, suddenly appears in front of the display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings, and BE well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never gets to say another word.  Spartan spins and ventilates the device with 40 mm slugs. Half a beat.  Realizes what he's done.  In the next moment, four insane megadrenalized cryocons come screaming through the door.  Barehanded, barefooted. Spartan SHOOTS the first two out of hand, without a thought.  But before he can fire again, the second two are on him. One gun goes flying.  Spartan beats on Howie with his free hand.  Ignacious fights for control of his gun hand. Spartan bashes Howie back for a moment, continues to tussle with Ignacious.  Finally, he's had enough --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go of the gun.  Ignacious grabs it and, still in shock over this turn of events, begins to fumble with it.  Spartan reaches up with both hands and breaks his neck. Howie leaps on him from behind, trying to do the same to Spartan.  Spartan squat presses down with this three hundred pound behemoth wrapped around his neck, retrieves the GUN out of Ignacious's stiffening fingers.  Turns the barrel around towards himself.  Howie reaches desperately, but it's just out of reach.  Spartan FIRES over his shoulder.  Howie, or what's left of him, slides away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Med Techs scramble furiously.  Phoenix grabs the glowing CompuClipboard from Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, who's left that's good? Ooooh, Ramon Gutieriz?  We gotta get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like a kid at FAO Schwartz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon jumps onto one of the cranes with a six clawed arm.  Stands at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does.  Moves too.  Bob has to trot to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of double doors slip silently open.  Spartan, a gun in each hand, slides in.  He is back in the stark white corridor where he once said good-bye to his wife and daughter.  Looks at the empty alcove.  It gives him the creeps.  He makes his way to the door at the far end, and steps in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan prowls through the now depleted multilifer wing. Empty pods everywhere. The displays all read:  CRYO PRISONER EXITED.  Yeeesh. There's a lot of them that way.  A WHIR, followed by TROTTING FOOTSTEPS. Spartan whirls.  A crane WHIRRING by and Associate Bob trotting behind.  Spartan follows.  Creeps slowly around the corner.  GUNS up... Comes around a turn to spot Phoenix locking the arm into a puck.  Takes aim. Phoenix sees him at the same time.  Yanks a control on the crane.  The puck pivots up as Spartan FIRES. The 40mm bullet lodges half in, half out of the puck in front of Phoenix's grinning face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand the meaning of give up?  You're too late, John.  I've got three more batches in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan FIRES again.  The puck barely vibrates.  Absorbs another round beside the unharmed cryocon. Phoenix unleashes an entire magazine from an HK91 slung over his back.  Spartan FIRES once, dives for cover. Although unhit, he gets seriously frosted from a pipe blow open next to him.  Forced to roll through the line of fire to avoid permanent freezer burn.  There are pipes burst everywhere. Phoenix turns to find Bob slinking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you good luck, sir.  This is an activity that requires testicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers) True 'nuf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice is beginning to form on the surface of everything nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take those stairs, I'll cover you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob nods gratefully.  Does.  Phoenix shakes his head at Bob's gullibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto; to himself) No brains either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan hears FOOTSTEPS coming.  Whirls.  FIRES.  Blows Bob away.  A momentary distraction, but it's enough. Phoenix is gone. Spartan turns slowly.  Guns out in each direction. Searching.  A sound.  FIRES.  No Simon.  More PIPES BURST.  It's ten or twenty degrees below zero in there already.  Everything is coated with supercooled ice. Footing becomes treacherous. Phoenix crawls through a jungle of pipe.  Gets a bead on Spartan's lower body.  Starts to strafe the area.  Dh uh. Everything has become so slick, the recoil drives him bac across the ice into the open.  Spartan sees him, FIRES. The recoil slams him back against a wall.  He FIRES again with something firm to lean on, but the recoil from Phoenix's sputtering weapon drives him right over the edge.  He drops off into the center out of Spartan's sight.  Slipping and sliding, Spartan slithers down the stairs to --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN LEVEL
dialogues.text: A familiar WHIRRING.  Turns.  Half a beat later he is bodyslammed and smashed and grabbed by a six-armed crane. His guns go flying, off into God knows where... Spartan is hoisted high in air, smashed again and again against a pillar.  Phoenix slams him through a web of pipes.  Holds him in the freezing blast.  Ice forms all over Spartan.  He struggles.  It cracks off, reforms. Struggles again.  It cracks off.  Reforms.  Struggles again.  He's weakening. Reaches up.  Grabs the pipe, wrests it over, directs the blast at Phoenix.  Holds it steady.  Phoenix is frozen in place.  Coats in ice.  We can see the madness in his eyes.  Everything else is still.  He roars, breaks free.  Retreats from the blast.  Disappears as -- Spartan wrenches the pipe over to the claw arm.  Holds it directly over one joint.  Then clobbers it with the pipe.  It SHATTERS.  He drops. LIGHTS are beginning to EXPLODE from the cold.  It's dropped 30 degrees below zero in there by now.  Spartan spots Phoenix on the far side of the room.  Hundred feet away. Half a moment to catch his breath in the freezing cold, leans on exposed cryopuck.  It slides effortlessly. Spartan hurls it across the floor at Phoenix.  A five hundred pound hockey puck.  Phoenix barely avoids the crushing blow.  It rebounds back off the steel... No point fighting the elements.  Spartan hurls himself across the floor.  Spins slowly twice along the way. It's like zero grav in two dimensions.  No friction coefficient at all. Three quarters of a second across the floor.  Right hook into Phoenix's surprised face. Phoenix goes flying a hundred feet back into the far side.  Crashes and falls. The CRYO PRISON CREAKS and SCREAMS in protest from the cold.  LIGHTING, grids, struts SHATTER, fall about them. They hurl themselves together again.  Spartan lands a horrific blow.  All but drives Phoenix's nose and eye sockets through the back of his head.  Spartan's forearm is terribly cut. The blood freezes solid as it sprays, sealing the wound, and leaving a giant six foot red feather spray.  Spartan brushes it away, breaks off, bleeds, freezes again instantly. They fly apart again.  Spartan comes to a stop near a tool cart.  Pokes at the tools.  One is an MTL cutting laser.  He has no idea what it is.  Nothing there he recognizes.  Picks up a four foot wrench.  That, he recognizes.  He looks like a caveman.  A very angry caveman. The building complains loudly.  Falling apart around them.  More and more PIPES EXPLODE, BURST, it gets colder and colder.  50 degrees below by now. Phoenix, on the far side, also scrambles for a weapon. He sees an MTL as well, but he knows what it is. FIRES it up.  Focused three inch cutting beam comes out.  Rips off the top cover, pulls out five optical elements, pulls out the choke tube, rips the whole front off the MTL.  Doesn't look very sleek now. FIRES it. A thirty foot long spray of white white magnesium- thermite flame comes flying out. One swipe, he clears the ice from a path he can walk towards Spartan on. Metal bars melt away as the thermite flare crosses through them. On the top level of the cryo prison, the first batch of raving psychopath defrosted cryocons wanders in to watch John Spartan die. This is the most depraved, frightening-looking group of individuals you've ever seen in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him!!  Kill him!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan looks up at them.  Like he needs this shit... Simon continues to melt himself a path across the floor towards Spartan. The heat from the MTL is furious.  The difference between the 2000 degrees plus and 80 degrees below is more than any metal can handle.  Fissures appear in giant lightning strike cracks in all directions where the MTL hits. Every bit of ice in the building melts.  Water boiling away instantaneously in the path of the MTL. Spartan has nowhere to run.  And nothing but a big fucking club.  To his left he suddenly sees an empty chamber.  Except this one was never filled.  The display reads:  READY FOR CRYO. There's a tiny white chip in the vial inside the vacuum bell.  Spartan looks at it.  It's like a very bad memory coming back.  But he knows what it is and knows what it does.  Smashes the vacuum bell with the wrench. Simon grows closer. Spartan bashes the robot arm out of the way.  Picks up the vial.  Looks around desperately.  No point using it if it's going to kill him too.  Grabs the grid of the floor above him.  Heaves himself up. Simon lifts the MTL towards him.  It almost reaches up to the landing above.  Spartan hurls the VIAL at Simon's feet. It SHATTERS.  Nothing happens.  The heat from the MTL has boiled off all the water in a ten foot circle nearby. The MTL flame comes closer.  In a moment Spartan will get cooked.  Instead of running away, he moves closer. Stands up on the railing of the second landing.  And just as his clothes begin to catch fire from the heat, leaps -- Over the oncoming thermal flame as it arcs up towards him.  And over and past Phoenix. Spartan lands behind him, coming around with an elbow into Phoenix's kidney, causing Phoenix to drop the MTL. Outside their circle of heat, the tiny chip hits the water.  Melts.  And again, like the opposite of watching ice shatter, the water everywhere goes steel solid, stuttering out in all directions. Phoenix still has a free hand.  Smashes a nerve center on the side of Spartan's neck.  Spartan twitches visibly from it.  Grunts. Spartan punches him right, left, right in the sternum. Phoenix coughs blood, spits it away. Steps back to launch a mighty blow at Spartan and -- His heel just steps into a puddle of water.  The tiniest rivulet drifts over, connects it to the main ice solid locked water. Simon feels his foot stuck.  And as he looks down in consternation, realizes in shock what's happened and then looks up, Spartan hits him straight from the shoulder with everything he has left, dead in the face, as Phoenix solidifies. Phoenix's head snaps clean off. Hits, like a ball bearing on polished steel.  Bounces with a CLANG.  Rolls off.  CLANG, CLANG, CLANG, CLANG, CLANG. Spartan reaches desperately for the still spewing MTL as the rivulets close in towards him. Grabs onto it just in time.  Spins, melts off a protective circle around him. Looks up at the peanut gallery of cryocons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, who's next???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody moves.  Nobody can move.  Every last one is dead.  Frozen in place. The building continues to collapse around Spartan.  More LIGHTS BLOW OUT.  A giant beam comes crashing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a massive understatement) I think it's time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully melting a path to the door, Spartan comes through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MTL still blazing, the hall bursts into flame around him as he leaves.  He takes no chances.  Continues to melt and burn his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the building, but still inside the gate.  Spartan pauses, still holding the flaming MTL, thinks about it a sec, torches the rest of the whole evil fucking place.

dialogues.speaker: GATE
dialogues.text: As Spartan steps through, the MTL sputters to a halt. He tosses it aside.  The cryo prison burns, explodes, freezes, contracts, expands behind him. A far greater crowd has gathered.  Police, citizens, Scraps.  They watch in silent awe and shock as Spartan re-emerges.  Katherine walks up.  Deadpan as her father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Dad. (kisses him on the cheek) Come by sometime for dinner. (re:  the destruction) I'll cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her back on the cheek.  She smiles, they hug.  Lenina watches from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was it?  That's the whole kissing thing?  What was Cocteau so worried about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan grabs her.  Lays a real kiss on her.  Long and hard.  She comes up for air, gasping, eyes shiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  My. (then) Is the rest of fluid transfer activities like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; dry) Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Better                          Oh.  My.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him.  Long and hard.  Breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the future, John Spartan.  Now that you've destroyed everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws an arm over her shoulder.  They turn and walk away.  They head off into the sunrise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I'm gonna like it here. (a beat; then) There's one thing I want to know though.  How does that damn three seashells thing work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the MUSIC COMES UP and obscures her explanation we --
